loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. She graduated from primary school. She will use this loan to develop her business and to purchase a sewing machine and cloth. The borrower has a high reputation and she is a trustworthy woman which has made her gain lots of clients. The borrower has acquired a great deal of experience in sewing women’s garments of good quality and at reasonable prices. She will benefit from this loan and can also raise the income of her family.

loans.use: For purchasing a sewing machine & cloth

loans.name: Salome Marcos

texts.pt:
Salomé Marcos M. nasceu na Provincia de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique,é solteira  mãe de 2 filhas de 24 e 26 anos de idade nenhuma das duas encontra se a estudar, pois trabalham todas juntas. Fez somente 4ª classe e não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa propria e para além das suas filhas responsabiliza se pelos seus 4 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa, consegue poupar 2.000.00mt.

Saiu de Gaza para o Distrito de Namaacha com sua amiga a procura de emprego, chegado começa a trabalhar no Governo do Distrito como servente, mas devido a doença ela teve que abandonar o emprego porque a descriminavam no seu sector de trabalho. Os anos foram passando Salomé começa a trabalhar com plantas de varias especies tais como,(azaleias, antores e catos) pois são faceis de multiplicar e  ela tem muito jeito para jardinhagem e cultiva um lindo jardim em sua casa. Hoje  é uma das mais famosas da região, vendendo flóres ate para pessoas da capital Maputo ganhando por mês aproximadamente 10.000.00mt porque para além de vender ela tem contratos de jardinhagem com proprietários de quintas na vila.


Este é o quarto empréstimo de Salomé na Hluvuku e Kiva, no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar sementes para a multiplicação das suas plantas. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de (15.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 20.000.mt) forão para a mesma finalidade. 

Esta confiante que vai melhorar muito no seu negócio e deste modo reembolsar sem nenhum problema.
texts.en:
Salomé Marcos M. was born in the Gaza Province, South Mozambique. She is single and has two daughters who are 24 and 26 years old. None of them go to school because they all work together. She only went to school until 4th grade and did not finish due to a teen pregnancy. She lives in her own home and besides her two daughters, she also supports her four grandchildren who live with her. She manages to save 2,000 meticais.

She left Gaza to go to the Namaacha District with a friend, looking for work. Once she got there she started working for the District's government, as a janitor. She had to leave her job due to the workplace discrimination she suffered because of her illness. Years went by and Salome started working with various plants (azaleas, antores and catos) because they are easy to multiply. She has a gift for gardening and grows a beautiful garden in her house. Today she is one of the most famous flower sellers in the region. She even sells to people in the capital, Maputo. She makes approximately 10,000 meticais because besides selling she has gardening contracts with the village's landowners. 

This loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticais, is Salome's fourth with Hluvuku and Kiva. She intends to purchase seeds to multiply her plants. The previous loans were for 15,000, 10,000 and 20,000 and were used for the same goal.

She is confident she will increase her business and that she will have no issues paying the loan back.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds to multiply her plants

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expand their businesses and make progress in their lives

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel P. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. He is 43 years old. Ruel is single. To make a living, Ruel owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "abal-habal" services to local community members. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. Ruel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed to expand services provided. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ruel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed to expand services provided

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been selling foodstuffs (deep fried potatoes) for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Zawadi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot summer season, the supply of potatoes in the market is lower, hence she cannot meet the demand of her customers. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of beans, rice and utensils for her food stall. Zawadi decided to join Yehu because it's easy to join.

loans.use: To  purchase stock of beans, rice and utensils for her food stall

loans.name: Asifa's Group

texts.en:
Asifa is a resident of Lahore, which is famous in Pakistan for its history and culture. She is a widow whose husband died suddenly a few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her, but she recovered her senses for her children. She started a business sewing clothes for her neighbouring clients. Her sons have had to leave their education and start doing work to financially support their mother. Her eldest son has a business selling ready-made garments while her younger son works as a medical representative for a pharmaceutical company.

Asifa has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her elder son’s ready-made garments business. With the loan, he will buy a variety of ready-made garments in bulk quantity, which will help him make more income and increase sales.

He has been running this business for some time now and Asifa is hopeful that a loan investment will bring good profits for her son. She wants to help him marry and she is hopeful that better business conditions will help her save more money for his marriage. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and is hopeful that this will be a good profitable experience for her.

Note: In the photo, the woman who is raising her hand is Asifa.

loans.use: To buy ready-made garments for resale.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 61 years old. He is married and has two children, aged 25 and 23. Rogelio has been a farmer for more than a few years already. He enjoys spending time at the farm, keeping it free of weeds and pests. He aims to increase his harvest and earn a better income. 

Rogelio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Airish

texts.en:
Airish N. is from the village of Guanzon Tuto St. Gingoog City. She is 23 years old. Airish is single. To make a living, Airish owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells lotions, perfumes and deodorants from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Airish has been engaged in her business for more than a  year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Airish joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Airish is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This will be the first loan taken by Airish from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

location.town: Guanzon Tuto St., Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 35 years old and belongs to the historic Pakistani city of Lahore. Lahore is the second-largest city of Pakistan. She lives there in a small house that consists of three rooms with her husband, brother, and four children. Three of her children are enrolled in a local school, while the youngest is one year old.

Her husband is a painter by profession and paints walls, ceilings, and houses on order. He makes deals with building and house owners and completes their work in the set time to earn an income for the family. Her brother is a scrap dealer. He operates a scrap shop in the market, and support Mumtaz financially through his earnings. Mumtaz supports her family by selling paper envelopes. She receives orders from different stationary shops and fulfills the orders on time. Besides her business, she has also proved herself to be a very good housewife, who takes care of her household responsibilities very well.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother who will buy scrap, such as used paper and plastic bottles, for his scrap business and make more income by increasing his sales. Mumtaz is hopeful that investing her loan money in her brother’s business will make him stand on his own feet and that his income will also be increased. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy scraps for her recycling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 39 years old. Rosalinda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda raises crops, primarily rice, for sale. Rosalinda is just starting this business.

Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional piglets and feeds. This will be the ninth loan taken by Rosalinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI earned a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, piglets and feeds

loans.name: Kimeu

texts.en:
Kimeu M. is a 44-year-old farmer. He is married and has one child. He practices mixed farming in Machakos, Kenya. He employs six people in his busy farm and sells his produce locally. 

Kimeu is a member of Twone Mbee SHG (a self-help group) and they have guaranteed him a loan of 80000 KES. With this loan, Kimeu wants to buy a dairy cow to increase his herd. He hopes to own a dairy plant in the future. He describes himself as focused and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn V. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 37 years old. Rosalyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalyn raising crops, particularly rice, for sale. Rosalyn works hard to sustain her business.

Rosalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Now she is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 59 years old, married, and has seven children. To make a living, Jesus raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jesus shares that his farm is a big help to his family for it helps provide for their needs. He works hard to keep it productive.

Jesus joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm needs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm needs

loans.name: Maria Annie

texts.en:
Maria Annie M. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Annie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods, and detergents in the local community. Maria Annie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maria Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Annie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Maria Annie is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. This loan will be Maria Annie's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Revelieta

texts.en:
Some people say that life is sweet, but still never without bitter moments that one has to go through and overcome. Our CCT* community partner, Revelieta D. C. or Nene as friends call her, proves it to be so. At 30, Revelieta has reached college and is married to Eddie, an ice cream maker. Their sweet marriage brought to life one child, who is in elementary school. REvelieta's family resides in Caloocan City, Philippines.

At present, Revelieta focuses on running her sari-sari (variety) store. She aims to meet the daily needs of her neighborhood with soft drinks and grocery items such as shampoo, canned goods, seasonings, among others. She also sells products from Avon, a brand of beauty products. With this business, Revelieta earns an average of Php300 a day.

Revelieta knows inside of her that the variety store would not be enough to meet the needs and wants of her family. To continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for Php11, 000 loan. She plans to use this money to add more items to her store. 

One challenge Revelieta faces at present is the difficulty of updating people with the payment of their debts. All that she dreams of in life is to make her family happy and give them a house they could call their own. She gives her best to make sure her only child gets a good education until  college. Life is not all the time sweet, but with all the efforts she is doing for her family, she sees to it that she will emerge an overcomer bringing home a sweet success. 


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To add additional stock to her variety store

loans.name: Faraho

texts.en:
Faraho is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Faraho has operated her food selling business selling chapati (flat bread) and beans for over five years, She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells clothes as another source of income. Faraho cites seasonality as her major challenge. During rainy season, she experiences a poor turnover of customers. She hopes to own a boutique for selling clothes in the future. 

With the Kshs 25,000  loan Faraho wants to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children .

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth V. is from the town of Surallah. She is 49 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 4 children. Her eldest child is 24 years old and the youngest is 11. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elizabeth also grows pigs for fattening and sale. She hopes to acquire more piglets to raise.

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and 3 piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and 3 piglets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 37 years old, married, and has two kids. The borrower graduated from primary school. He will use this loan to develop his mechanic shop and purchase spare parts. The borrower has great experience in his job and has a good character. He is able to perform good jobs at reasonable prices and that makes the clients satisfied and they become his regular clients.

loans.use: For purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn B. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old. Jenelyn is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jenelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, instant noodles, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jenelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jenelyn is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & to use as working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jenelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily P. is from the town of Surallah. She is 49 years old and has a 23-year-old child. Emily is separated from her spouse and does her best to sustain her child and herself. She owns a rice field and hires laborers to till and maintain the farm. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale. 

Emily joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Emily is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and pig feed

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie E. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old,  married, and has five adult children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk foods in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. This loan will be Elsie's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
