loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 45 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 children aged 24, 22 and 21. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. loans.name: Surma's Group

texts.en:
On January 31, USAID, Mercy Corps, and local government representatives opened the Veterinary Service and Artificial Insemination Center in Nookat, Osh Oblast. This was the first of nine centers to be opened in southern Kyrgyzstan with support from USAID’s Community Development Initiative (CDI) project, implemented by Mercy Corps. CDI was designed to address problems related to deterioration of livestock health and productivity, which has lead to declines in the quantity and quality of meat and dairy in the region.

Surma S., 52, is a leader of this group. She lives in Kadamjai. She is left with her grandchildren, while all three of her kids left to Russia to earn income.  Recently her son gave her a good idea. He suggested sending his earnings to her, so that she can purchase dairy cattle for starting a small business. But she’s afraid it won’t be enough for a business start-up. So Surma applied for this loan in hopes of increasing the number of cattle and build a house from the proceeds. Surma is confident that she’ll be able to repay it successfully.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man living with his family in Lebanon. This talented man has been working in producing jewelry since 1998. He started his career when he was very young and he learned it from his father’s friend. He delivers his products to a local jewelry shop and he also makes a variety of designs upon the request of the customers.  He is thankful for his business income and he helps his father with the household expenses in collaboration with his brother. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a special jewelry table where he can perform his work properly. In the future, he hopes to open a jewelry shop in his town as his own business to present his products and designs.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Annet hopes to study hair dressing. loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida T., 51, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Ramon T., a butcher, they find comfort in their children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough for their three children who still live with them, so that they can have a better life. She has been managing her variety store while operating a food vending business as well.

Zenaida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship* meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses. 

To help her continue operation of her businesses, she would like to apply for a PHP40,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries, toiletries and beverages for her variety store. She will also use some of the loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her food vending business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can leave a successful business as a legacy to them.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business and additional stock for her variety store.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Being a mother, 43 year old Wilma is concerned about the lives of her five children who still live with her and are dependent on her. Instead of allowing herself to get stuck in the middle of insecurities, in 2008, she joined KIVA field partner in the Philippines, ASHI, to be able to access a loan which will enable her productive self to flourish.

Through previous loans she’s availed, she utilized them in her fishing business. The profits she will be getting will augment her husband’s income, who is a fisherman and fish vendor, and as soon as it grows, she will be able to support her children’s education until they are finished college and provide other needs in order to enjoy the gifts of life. By then, her role of mother will be fulfilled. 

Her membership in ASHI and the loans she has had since she became a member assisted her in operating her fishing business. Because of this, Wilma has performed very well in her credit rating (basis of loans), thus making her qualified for a higher amount of loan.

Wilma is very glad to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support to her business dreams.

loans.use: To finance her fishing business.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a mother from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Fareeda has two daughters and two sons, and the sons are already working and responsible for their families. The two daughters, Mai and Asma, are college students.

Fareeda's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. A couple of years ago he started a small grocery store to increase the family's income and to be able to cover his daughters' education expenses.

Fareeda came to FATEN and took a loan because her husband wants to enlarge the store and sell a larger variety of products in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

Fareeda's son Salama appear in the picture here as she is a conservative woman like most inhabitants of Gaza.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Good Luck” group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are small-businesswomen who have come to SMT – also a partner of Kiva – in order to seek a loan of SLL 600,000 for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Salamatu S.. Salamatu was born in Makeni city about fifty-five years ago. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a driver and her children are no longer attending school. Salamatu sells both fresh and dried fish. She has been a businesswoman for twenty years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her business

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik A. is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Ijevan city. Hasmik works at an accounting firm as an accountant. At the same time, she and her husband are engaging in swine breeding and land cultivation, which they run not far from their house. This business enables them to support their family. She and her husband also help Hasmik’s parents, who engage in swine breeding as well, with farming in Sargyugh village. 
Hasmik says pig breeding is a profitable business, so she wants to increase her farming. Hasmik is asking for a 750,000 AMD loan to buy three or four pigs and fodder for them.

loans.use: To buy three or four pigs and fodder for them

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic E. is requesting a large loan to support the needs of her fishing business and at the same to continue its operation. With Marivic’s passion of giving her family a brighter tomorrow, she will be eager to work hard and help her husband to meet the needs of her family. Marivic’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a decent way of life, out of poverty.
 
Her long-term goals are to help support her children’s education until they complete college, invest and build a better house for the family, have a winning business providing a life that is full of happiness.

A dedicated member of ASHI since 2006, Marivic has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and timely repayments on loans. Since joining ASHI, she has gained more self-confidence as an entrepreneur managing her own fishing business.

loans.use: To finance her fishing business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 54 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Edna raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edna also grows hogs and sells dried fish. She does all these activities to earn enough for her family and have savings.

Edna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Edna is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, hog feeds, and additional dried fish. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, hog feeds, and additional dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more bags of sugar and beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 59-year-old married man living with his wife and two children in Lebanon. He is an experienced carpenter. He has owned his shop for almost 30 years. He manufactures home furniture and he works closely with some local galleries. He also makes home furniture for clients. He presents many choices and designs from furniture catalogs. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members, and at the same time run a business. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new pusher machine. This new machine will allow him to increase his manufacturing and deliver his products faster. In the future, he is looking to further expand his merchandise and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: To purchase a new pusher machine

loans.name: Charcoal Sellers Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Charcoal Sellers” group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. These women are petty traders who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their business inventories, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Umu S.. Umu was born in the southern city of Bo. She is forty-five years of age. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a salaried worker and two of her children are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Umu sells charcoal and firewood. She has been a businesswoman for twenty years now. With her share of this loan she will buy charcoal and firewood in large quantity to add to her business stock.

loans.use: Buy charcoal and firewood in large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and cowpeas at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and cowpeas to sell. Betty is 29 and married to a peasant. She has four children, two of which go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans and cowpeas to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena E., 58, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has eight children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elena also grows hogs for fattening and sells the pork meat to the market.

Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, pig feed and vitamins. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam B., 19, lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school.  Mariam has a business selling charcoal which she has had for two years.

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Mariam hopes to own a plot. Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete the necessities of the wedding party

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 18 years old, single, and has one child.  She lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  Aisha has a business of selling fish, which she has had for one year.   To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase fish.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Aisha hopes to expand her business.  

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene U. is 29 years old, married, and has one child. Married to Angelo U., a fish vendor, she makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough for them to have a better life. She has been managing her fish vending business for many years.

Mylene has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for over a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow a number of times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more fish to sell in the market.  She dreams that her business will continue to grow and she have her own stall.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Raida

texts.en: Raida M. sells green vegetables and fruit like oranges, lemons, etc.  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of fruit to sell. Raida is 27 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of fruit, especially lemons, to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Lebanese Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. One of the children is still attending school. He has more than 20 years of experience running a small car repair shop. He is the main income provider of his family. Today, he is requesting a loan of $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase the capital for his business by purchasing a new electric lift for the cars. In the future, he hopes to continue expansion of his business. He is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell spare car parts. He expects the coming year to be successful and to further increase his business productivity. His business income is important to support his wife and children.

loans.use: To purchase a new electric lift machine for the cars

loans.name: Dusman

texts.en: Dusman J. sells sugar, coffee, salt, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell. Dusman is 24 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children; two go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty Y. sells fish, onions, tomatoes, and beans and is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour and rice to sell. Betty is 22 years old and married to a business man. She has two children, one of whom goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

loans.use: Stock bags of maize flour, rice etc to sell

loans.name: Gabiro Group

texts.fr:
Emelyne H. est une commerçante âgée de 25 ans qui habite la Commune Rugombo en Province Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de boissons il ya de cela 10ans. Elle n’a  pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée a Jean-Marie  Mvuyekure qui fait lui aussi le commerce de boissons. Ils ont 3 enfants dont 1 étudie. Elle arrive au 3e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de  boisson à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, elle pourra acheter une parcelle pour construire leur propre maison et  assurer les besoins élémentaires familiaux et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.  

Il  est la présidente  du groupe  communautaire« Gabiro».
texts.en:
Emelyne H. is a 25 year old business woman who lives in the commune Rugombo, in the Cibitoke Province, western Burundi. She has been in the beverage business for 10 years ago. She did not attend school. She is married to Jean-Marie Mvuyekure, who is also in the beverage business. They have three children, and one of them is attending school. She is in her third credit cycle with the Community by Turama credit.
She requested the Kiva loan to improve her stock by purchasing a large quantity of soft drinks to resell as well as to increase her funds. She hopes to save enough to buy a plot to build her own house, provide for the basic needs of her family and pay the school tuition for her children.
She is also the president of the community group Gabiro.

loans.use: To improve stock by purchasing a large quantity of soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely R., 57, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has four children. To make a living, Fely raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Fely also grows hogs and runs a sari-sari store. She also sometimes cooks food which she sells at her store.

Fely joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Fely is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر ال 22 سنة غير متزوج يعمل في مصلحة الادوات الصحية منذ 6 سنوات يعمل بجد ونشاط  يحب عمله فهو 
يعمل به منذ كان في عمر صغير وهذه المصلحة وريثها عن والده طموح يسعى الى زيادة مدخوله وتأمين عيش افضل له ولعائلته محبوب   
يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى توسيع المصلحة وشراء بضاعة جديدة زبائنه من محيطه  وجيرانه يلقى دعم من عائلته فهو    جدي  في التعامل                                                                                                    
يسعى الى طلب الرزق وزيادة المدخول لتحسين الاوضاع المادية وخاصة انه في ريعان شبابه
texts.en: Mohamed is 22 years old. He is single and has been working in the field of sanitary ware for six years. He is diligent, active and loves his job.  Mohamed has been in the business since he was very young. He inherited his business from his father, and strives to increase his income, ensuring a better future for him and his family. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, Mohamed seeks to expand his business and purchase new products.  Mohamed’s clients are his friends and neighbors.  He has the support of his family as he is a responsible individual. Mohamed hopes to be able to increase his income, especially since he is very young.

loans.use: To purchase new products and expand business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda F., 42, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has a 7-year-old child. To make a living, Imelda raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Imelda works hard to sustain her family and her child's education.

Imelda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy G., 34, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has two children, aged two and eight. To make a living, Joy raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joy works hard to keep her farm productive.

Joy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Joy is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zerida

texts.en:
Zerida L. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children. Both of her children are currently in school. Zerida has a business of selling vegetables, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Zerida has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase vegetables.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zerida hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees.  In the future, Zerida hopes to own a hotel. Zerida is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to use money.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina G. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  None of her children are currently in school.  Regina has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Regina has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Regina hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself and her children.  In the future, Regina hopes to own a plot of land. Regina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina N. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and piped water. 

She runs a school, which she established three years ago. Her neighboring children attend her school. She took a photo with her school children. Victorina faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing text books for reading. She hopes to establish a big education center and open another school in the future. 

Victorina decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business. With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase books and furniture (tables and chairs) for her school.

loans.use: To purchase books and furniture (tables and chairs) for her school.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.ar:
زهرة في عمر 45 سنة متزوجة ولها ولد واحد تعيل زوجها واسرتها فهي تحب عائلتها وتضعها في  الأولويات في حياتها فهي تريد تعليم ابنها بأحسن
صورة وان ترقى به في الحياة المعيشية  تساعد زوجها في تخطي الحياة الصعبة فهو لا يعمل , عائلتها تدعمها كثيرا لتطوير نفسها تعمل في مجال خياطة الالبسة والبرادي منذ 
اكثر من 10 سنوات تجد صعوبة مادية في تحسين وضع عملها ولهذا هي تريد قرض من المجموعة بهدف  شراء اقمشة لتفصيلها وبيعها كبرادي زبائنها من معارفها ومحيطها
ليس لديها صعوبات كبيرة لتحسين وضعها
texts.en: Zahra is 45 years old. She is married with one child. Zahra financially supports her husband and family. She loves her family and makes them her first priority.  Zahra wants to provide the best education possible for her son, and improve her family’s standard of living. She helps her husband through difficult times as he is currently unemployed. Zahra has the support of her family. She has been working as a seamstress for more than 10 years. She has financial burdens and would like to obtain a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase textiles and sell them as curtains. Her clients are mainly her family, friends, and acquaintances. She only faces few obstacles in enhancing her income.

loans.use: To purchase textiles to sew into curtains

loans.name: Manzooran Muhammad Saleem's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran M. S. is married and has given birth to two sons and two daughters (in the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Manzooran). All of her children are studying except the youngest who is just three years old. Manzooran is a talented lady who operates an embroidery and clothes sewing business from her home to supplement her family’s income. Most of her clients are from neighboring areas, and she receives a good number of orders every month.

Manzooran’s husband operates a CD center in the market from which he sells different DVDs and CDs of movies and songs. He deals with a good number of customers every day. Some of the customers buy CDs and DVDs while others rent them.

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah. She is a new Asasah client, and this is her first loan application. She is requesting a loan for the expansion of her husband’s business. He will use the money to purchase the latest CDs and DVDs to sell to his customers. He started this business six years ago, and Manzooran hopes that a loan will improve his business further.

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs for her husband's shop

loans.name: Kipkorir

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Kipkorir is a resident of Litein Town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has four children, two of whom are already attending school. He has been farming, and selling his milk produce in the local market.

He applied for this loan of KES 40,000, his third with Juhudi Kilimo (his first and second loans were for KES 22,500 and KES 20,000 respectively), to purchase a dairy cow. He plans to use the income generated to educate his children and build a dairy unit for his animals. He hopes to maintain three purebred dairy cows on his farm in five years' time. He earns additional income from employment as an accountant.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta T. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 56 years old. Julieta is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Julieta also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells different products like sugar and soft drinks.

Julieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a kiosk (retail shop) for the past five years. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Josephina faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She hopes to be self reliant in the future.

Josephine decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 30,000 loan she wants to purchase maize flour, washing soap, maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, washing soap, maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children. He is from Lebanon. He is an experienced carpenter with almost 10 years of experience. He manufactures different wood products such as doors and home furniture and he works closely with some locA. galleries. He also makes home furniture for his clients. He presents many choices and designs from furniture catalogs. He works hard to support his housewife and his young children. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additionA. wood. In the future, he is looking to further expand his merchandise and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy N., 18, lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Mercy has a retail shop selling charcoal, which she has had for 2 years.

To help expand her business, Mercy has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and charcoal. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mercy hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Mercy hopes to study computers. Mercy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to protect herself from diseases such as HIV and AIDS.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and charcoal.

loans.name: Husu

texts.en: Husu M., 41, breeds cows and calves in the small village of Sabirabad. He has six years of experience in this field and currently has two cows. This business is only financial source in his family. Husu's son helps him a lot in looking after the animals. He wakes up early in the morning to feed the cattle and pastures them for the rest of the day. He is also very careful about vaccinating them on time. Now, he would like to increase his income and purchase two more cows. This will allow him to improve the lives of his four children.

loans.use: To purchase two more cows.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio S. Jr. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 53 years old and married. To make a living, Julio owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soft drinks and school supplies. Julio works hard to build his business.

Julio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julio has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Julio is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mona

texts.ar:
منى عمرها حوالي 57 سنة تعمل في بيع الالبسة الجاهزة لها في عملها حوالي 7 سنوات هي متزوجة لديها 2 اولاد تعمل بجد ونشاط تحب عائلتها
تعيل زوجها واولادها تتلقى دعم كبير من محيطها تريد تحسين مستواها المعيشي وتأمين الراحة لعائلتها فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة
جديدة لتطوير المصلحة وزيادة المدخول لا تجد صعوبة في عملها لها سمعة جيدة في محيطها العملي زبائنها جيرانها واقاربها
texts.en: Mona is 57 years old. She has been selling ready-made clothes for seven years. She is married with two children. Mona works diligently, loves her family, and supports her husband and children. She receives lots of help from those closest to her. Mona strives to increase her income and secure a comfortable life for her family. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, she seeks to purchase new clothes to sell, thereby expanding business and increasing her income. Mona does not find difficulty in her work.  She has a good reputation within the field. Her clients are mainly her neighbors and relatives.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell and expand business

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan A. is a 44 year old farmer who breeds cattle in the small village of Imishli city. He started his business in 2007, and since that time he gained a reputation of a farmer who always has quality milk. He usually sells milk to the local milk farm, and milk and homemade yoghurt to the local people. He successfully finished his loan with KIVA and AqroInvest and was very satisfied with the results, and now he has applied for a 800 AZN loan to purchase one more cow. He believes this loan will help to increase his monthly income and to improve the life of his beloved children and wife. He wishes one day he could have at least 10 cows.

loans.use: To purchase one cow.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 63 years old. Lucia is married and has 10 children. Her eldest child is now 45 years old, while the youngest is 22. To make a living, Lucia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lucia also raises hogs for fattening and sale. She hopes to earn better and be able to support her family financially.

Lucia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Bendetta

texts.en:
Bendetta is a married woman with five children, three of whom still attend school while two graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop for over four years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a taxi business which contributes to her other source of income. Bendetta hopes to run a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice, sugar and peas for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple loaning procedures.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, rice, sugar and peas for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 51, is a farmer from Agusan del sur. She does coconut farming and food processing as her source of living of her family. She’s a mother of 4 children, the eldest is 20 years old. She needs additional capital to finance her farm.  

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 4,000 Php. She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil A. is a 32 year old cattle breeder who has been selling milk and milk products along with meat to the local farmers since 2005. He also works as a policeman, but his salary is too small to raise 2 sons. Ismayil has 3 cattle now and wishes to increase their numbers to many. While Ismayil is out at work, his wife looks after the animals. He already has a successful loan history with KIVA and AqroInvest and promises to repay accurately.

loans.use: To purchase one cow.

loans.name: Ruri Mae

texts.en:
Ruri Mae, 24, is a rice farmer. She started helping her husband till a farm to raise money for the entire family's needs. She is doing the best she can to be a good mother and a good wife. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying farming necessities. With this loan, she doesn’t need to apply for a loan from loan sharks who charge higher interest rates.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica, is a rice farmer from Agusan del sur. She owns a farm that she hopes can provide her family with enough income to buy adequate food, clothing and other basic needs. She has only 1 child who is 17 years old. She wishes that some day she will be able to buy more farms to be able to support all the family's needs.  

She is asking a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming necessities to grow her harvest. With this loan, she doesn’t need to apply for a loan from loan sharks who charge high interest rates.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Señorita Irma tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de dos niñas de edad escolar, vive en la compañía Cerro Real, en su domicilio posee una despensa bien surtida, en el barrio es la única despensa la mayoría de sus cliente son sus vecinos.
 La señorita Irma trabaja  muy bien en su negocio no obstante le falta algunas mercaderías de primera necesidad que les pide sus clientes, es por la razón que solicita un prestamos a la fundación y Kiva y a la vez agradece por el apoyo obtenido.
Desea comprar productos como ya que son los más consumidos: fideos, arroz, harina, y otros.
texts.en:
Irma is 29 years old.  She is a single mother and has two school-age daughters.  She lives in Cerro Real.  In her home she has a well-stocked grocery store.  Hers is the only grocery store in her neighborhood and most of her customers are neighbors.

Irma works very well in her business but she lacks some basic merchandise which her customers are requesting.  This is why she is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.  She is grateful for the support she is receiving.

She would like to buy those products which are most frequently consumed such as noodles, rice, flour and others.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as noodles, rice, bakery products, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for Nora, 40. Her business is located in Agusan del sur. She has a good harvest when the weather is good and no pests attack. She tills a rice field to support her family. She is already a widow and a mother of 2 children, the eldest is 10 years old.

She requested a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. of 4,000 Php for additional capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en: Merilyn is a rice farmer in Agusan del sur. She is 32 years old with 4 children. She is able to sustain her family through her farm. She manages a rice field. Now, she needs financial assistance, and that’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to get a loan with low interest. She has requested 4,000 Php to improve her farm and buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Azar

texts.en: Azar A. is 31, married, and has two children. He has been engaged in cattle breeding since 2008. Together with his wife Azar, they have been raising one cow. He sells milk and milk products to the local people. This is the only financial source for Azars`s family and he's trying his best to cover all the needs of his beloved children. Now he has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase one more dairy cow and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, 41, has a rice farming business. She has been doing this farming business for 15 years already. She has a rice field in Agusan del sur, and loves her work in the farm. She is a mother of 6 children, and strives hard in order to provide the basic needs of the family.

She requested a loan of 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to financially support her farm. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir A. keeps two cows and this is the only financial source for this family. He has been running his business since 2008 and sells milk products to the local milk farm, and there is also a high demand for this product among the local people. Samir is married and has two sons. He usually buys small calves for a good price, fattens, and then sells them at the Livestock Bazaar in Imishli city (1 hour away from his home city) once every 6 months.  Now he has applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two more cows.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en:
The rice farming business of Maria Rosa is improving with the financial help offered by microfinance institutions. She was able to finance her business with a small interest charge.

Now she has requested a loan of 4,000 Php to continually support her rice field. She is glad that her daily needs are met by the income she receives.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Anaciata

texts.en:
Anaciata is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a poultry business for the past two years, selling to her neighbours, passersby and restaurant operators. Anaciata cites the outbreak of diseases for the chicks, and the high cost of transportation as her major challenges in the business. She hopes to buy more chicks and supply the hotels in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks, chicken feed and chicken medicine. She decided to join Yehu because it does not require much collateral.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, chicken feed and chicken medicine.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ramón González tiene 45 años de edad, está casado con la señora Mirta cañete quien tiene 38 años de edad, ambos nacidos de Piribebuy. 
 Viven en su domicilio propio posee una carpintería hace más de 8 años, allí fabrica y vende Cuadros con laminas de paisajes, Botiquines y Espejos, sus clientes en su mayoría son vendedores ambulantes  (Revendedores de todo tipo de artículos) de la zona y particulares.

  El señor Juan Ramón trabaja mucho porque constantemente recibe pedidos de sus productos de los clientes de distintos puntos del país, pero posee algunas necesidades como la compra de madera (que es la materia prima que utiliza para su fabricar sus productos) solicita un crédito a Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva para poder satisfacer la  Demanda en estas fechas festivas de Navidad y desde ya agradece por el apoyo obtenido.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón González is 45 years old.  He is married to Mirta Cañete who is 38 years old.  They were both born in Piribebuy.

Juan Ramón and his wife both live in their own home.  He has owned a carpentry workshop for more than 8 years where he makes and sells picture frames containing landscape prints, bathroom cabinets and mirrors.  His customers are mainly street traders from his district who re-sell all sorts of articles and also members of the public.

Juan Ramón works a lot because he is constantly receiving orders for his products from customers around the country but he has some needs such as the need to buy wood (this is the raw material which he uses to make his products).  He is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that he can meet demand during this Christmas period.  He is grateful for the support he is receiving.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Nasirdin

texts.en:
Nasirdin B. is a 51 year old farmer, married, and he has three children. After graduating from State agricultural university, he devoted his life to the agricultural sector. Nasirdin worked as an agronomist and at the same time, started his own business in cattle breeding and farming. With the initial sum of 6,000 Kyrgyz Soms, he cultivated land with holy clover and barley and managed to develop his farm. All these activities allowed him to reconstruct a house for his son in Naryn town and purchase three cows and one horse.

In order to broaden the number of cattle, Nasirdin obtained his first loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms and repaid it without any delays. Now Nasirdin is applying for his second loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase two bull-calves and ten sheep. With the revenues, he plans to buy a truck for transportation.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Walid

texts.ar:
وليد  هو في عمر 45 سنة يعمل في مجال تجميع الخردة والماكنات القديمة المستعلمة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل بكد ونشاط يحب عائلتها ويريد ان يؤمن لها حياة
افضل اجتماعيا وماديا له في عمله اكثر من 9 سنوات ما يميز عمله ان عدد الاشخاص الذين يعملون في هذا المجال قلائل فهو يطمح الى شراء بيك اب وفتح محل لبيع الخردة به
كان للقرض القديم تأثير جيد جدا عليه وهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء عربة لبيع الخردة عليها لأنه يجد صعوبة في بيعها بأكياس على ظهره له زبائن
ينتظرونه لكي يبيعوا له أشياءهم القديمة يحب عمله ويريد تطويره
texts.en: Walid is a 45-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family very much and wants to secure for them a better life. Walid enjoys more than nine years of experience collecting scrap metal and used machinery. Given that his last loan from Al Majmoua had a very positive impact on his work, Walid is now seeking another loan to purchase a pick-up truck to retrieve the scrap from various sellers and then resell it from the truck to his customers (he currently has to schlep the metal around with a bag). Walid is very driven in his work and is keen to further develop his business, on top of which he has an advantage in that not very many people are occupied in this field.

loans.use: Purchase pick-up truck to procure and resell scrap metal.

loans.name: Santigie A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is pleased to present to you teachers of the Government Technical Institute in Magburaka town, northern Sierra Leone. This institution was founded in 1962 by the government to train youths in technical and vocational education. The institute is staffed with nineteen teachers and has 300 students. 

This is the third loan that Government Technical Institute is requesting from Kiva through SMT. With their previous SMT/Kiva lenders loans, some of these teachers started small businesses. Some invested their loans in an already existing business. Some bought pieces of furniture, some bought house-building materials, some paid school fees for their children, and so on and so forth. With the help of this new loan, they will be able to once again do or invest in something bigger than their mere salaries alone will allow.

Santigie A. T. is the leader of this group of teachers. Santigie was born in a place call Makeh. He is married and has three children – two adults and one in secondary school. Santigie has had eleven years of experience in the teaching profession. In addition to his teaching, Santigie is also a farmer. He has requested a loan of SLL 2,000,000 in order to buy seeds to plant in his farm.

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant in his farm

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a fifty-four year old ambitious widow with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to establish an income-generating enterprise for her family. She has a nursery school that has been in operation for thirteen years, and this has enabled her to educate all her children.  Resty needs a loan to build classrooms for pupils.

loans.use: to build classrooms for pupils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Kobekun   (Tout Supporter) Group

texts.fr:
Kobekun est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien. Elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, le bois de chauffe, les céréales et les légumes. 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Oumou D., qui est un membre du groupe Kobekun (dans le tricycle) vend surtout du bois de chauffe.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes de bois  de chauffe auprès des paysans producteurs. Elle se procure  du bois dans les différents villages. 
Elle compte constituer un stock de bois  très important enfin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle vend  du bois en détail et au comptant à la maison à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Kobekun comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Oumou D., malgré son handicape physique, est très sollicitée, elle espère réaliser 120 000FCFA  de bénéfice au cours de ce cycle.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent renforcer leur partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient plus rares.
texts.en:
Kobekun is a group of women from Koutiala who know each other well. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. On average, they are 42 years old, married, and have at least five children.

This group sells various items such as firewood, grain and vegetables.

In order to expand their activities, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution two years ago. They are on their fifth group loan, and all previous loans were fully repaid.

Oumou D., a member of Kobekun (seen in the tricycle), sells mainly firewood. She plans to use her loan to buy cartloads of firewood from rural producers. She gets the wood in different villages.

She wants to build a substantial stock of firewood to meet customer demand. She sells the wood at retail from her home, for cash, to a clientele consisting mostly of women.

While the other members of the Kobekun group expect to make an average profit of 110,000FCFA each during this cycle, Oumou D., in high demand despite her physical disability, hopes to make a a profit of 120,000FCFA.

In addition to the loan repayments, they use a portion of their income to cover the family’s day-to-day expenses.

They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so as to avoid further depletion of their stocks.

loans.use: Buying firewood

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
La señora Ligia B. tiene 31 años de edad, está casado con el señor Wilson  Contrera, quien tiene 33 años de edad, ambos nacidos en la ciudad de Caacupe. Tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.

     La familia de Ligia B.  vive en el barrio Loma Guazu de la ciudad de Caacupe y en su domicilio posee un taller de Costura hace más de 4 años, allí fabrica y vende las remeras en ellas se encuentran impresas  la imagen de la virgen de Caacupe.

    La señora Ligia trabaja mucho y más en este tiempo cuando se acerca la fecha 8 de Diciembre (Fecha Espiritual del País, fiestas de la virgen de Caacupe) porque recibe pedidos al por mayor  de sus clientes que en su mayoría son vendedores que cuenta con sus casillas donde exhiben sus productos alrededor de la basílica de Caacupe. 
Pero posee algunas necesidades y solicita un crédito para la compra de Telas, y así poder satisfacer la Demanda de remeras en estas fechas festivas  de la virgen de Caacupe desde ya agradece a Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo obtenido.
texts.en:
Ligia B. is 31 years old.  She is married to Wilson Contrera who is 33 years old.  They were both born in the city of Caacupe and have 2 school-age children.

Ligia B.'s family live in Loma Guazu neighborhood, in the city of Caacupe and in her home she has a sewing workshop which she has had for more than 4 years.  There she makes and sells t-shirts which have the image of the Virgin of Caacupe printed on them.

Ligia works a lot and even more so in this period of the year as the 8th of December is approaching.  The 8th of December is a spiritual date in the country because it is the date of the fiestas of the Virgin of Caacupe.  At this time Ligia receives wholesale orders from her customers who are mainly salespeople who have booths where they exhibit their products around the Basilica of Caacupe.

However, Ligia has some needs and is requesting a loan to buy fabric so that she can fulfil the demand for t-shirts during this important period.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make t-shirts with the image of the Virgin of Caacupe on them

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He longs to have an educated family. He has been in the motorcycle transport sector for three years, which has helped him to provide the basics for his family. His desire is to have at least four motorcycles for business purposes. He needs this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe, in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sarah has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Sarah hopes to own a salon. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work, being a young girl.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Nikol

texts.en:
Nikol I. is 25 years old; he lives in Vazashen village, Ijevan area with his mother. After college he served in the Armenian Army and after that he got a job as a policeman. Simultaneously with his direct work, Nikol engages in farming. In his farm he breeds pigs and rabbits. His mother helps him in this work, and so they kept their family, paid for Nikol’s education and bought necessary furniture for their house. In addition Nikol has a hobby: he breeds pigeons and parrots in his farm. 

Nikol intends to increase his farming and therefore he is asking for a 350.000 AMD loan to buy two calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy two calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe, in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. All of her children are currently in school. Jamila has a business of a salon, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Jamila has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jamila hopes to generate greater profits and sometime, buy food. In the future, Jamila hopes to own a house. Jamila is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: To buy braids.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Es comerciante desde hace más de 10 años, empezó vendiendo primeramente en forma ambulante, con un pequeño ahorro y la ayuda de su marido que es empleado de una empresa envasadora de gaseosas, pudo formar su micro-comercio e instalarlo en su casa, gracias a la buena atención y la buenisima calidad de sus mercaderías hoy día tiene una clientela formada.
 La Sra. Maria solicita el crédito para la compra de shorts, jeans, remeras, vestidos y otros, que son las prendas con más demandas en esta época del año.
La Sra. María desde ya agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo y la confianza que le otorgan.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She has been a saleswoman for more than 10 years.  She started out selling as a street trader but, with a little saving and the help of her husband who is a worker in a soda packaging company, she has been able to set up a small business in her home.  Thanks to her good service and the really good quality of her merchandise she now has a fixed customer base.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy shorts, jeans, t-shirts, dresses and other clothes.  These are the garments which are in greatest demand at this time of year.

Maria is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support they are giving her and the trust which they are placing in her.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, jeans, shorts, dresses and other garments

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema, a resident of Lahore, Pakistan's second largest city and known for its history and culture, lives with her family in a four-room brick house in an area named Mughalpura. A 53-year-old widow, Haleema spent a very difficult time after the death of her husband and raised her five children with great hard work. Now her elder sons have grown up and they work to financially support the family.

Her eldest son has a quilt-making and sales business, making warm quilts at home and selling them to various shops in the market. Her next oldest son works in a factory, while the third one operates a vegetable-selling business. The remaining two are young and stay at home. Haleema couldn’t provide them with educational opportunities due to poor financial conditions.

Haleema is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son because the winter season has started and he has a large order to fill. He will use the loan to purchase cotton and cloth in bulk that will enable him to meet the order on time by making good quantity quilts. Haleema is planning his marriage and hopes that the loan profit will help her plans come true.

A regular loan user of Asasah, this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy cotton and cloth for quilt-making business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 40-year-old, married man living in his own house with 9 children in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to have a minimum income and savings for the family on a daily basis. For three years he has been selling clothes. The business has helped him pay rent and school fees for his children. He wishes to own a boutique in future. Joseph intends to use his loan to buy clothes to sell as the festive season nears.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for sale

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Rubén actualmente tiene 28 años, es comerciante desde hace más de 6 años, empezó primeramente como secretario de un vecino que le remuneraba por cada entrega de su mercadería, con el pequeño ahorro y la ayuda de un pequeño crédito de su proveedor pudo llegar a comprar su propia mercadería y formar su clientela a quienes les provee de  mercaderías, gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos hoy día tiene su clientela formada y que se está extendiendo por las recomendaciones de su propios clientes. 
El Sr. Rubén agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo recibido por medio de los créditos que les conceden,  gracias a eso pudo llegar a más clientes en distintas zonas y sus ingresos se vieron en alza.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de hilos.
texts.en:
Rubén is currently 28 years old, and has been a merchant for more than 6 years.  At first, he started out working for a neighbor who paid him for each delivery of merchandise.  With his small savings, as well as a loan from his supplier, he was able to buy his own merchandise and build a customer base to sell his products to.  Thanks to the excellent quality of his merchandise, today he has a well-established customer base that is growing thanks to the recommendations of his own clients.

Rubén appreciates Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva’s support through the loan grants.  Thanks to this assistance, he was able to attract more customers in other areas, and he saw his income grow.  He plans to use the loan he is requesting to purchase threads.

loans.use: To purchase threads.

loans.name: Omuhereza

texts.en: Omuhereza is a 60-year-old, ambitious woman, married with six children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her old-age wish is to build a permanent house, since all her life she has lived in a semi-permanent one. Her business is trading produce, such as maize, rice and groundnuts. She has been in the business for four years and has a vision of having storefronts. Omuhereza intends to use the loan to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sell

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a single woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over fifteen years, she has operated a food stall business at an open air market, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamkasi faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season only a few customers eat from her food stall. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and utensils for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and utensils for her food stall.

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en: Shukur B. is 45 years old man who sells meat in his own butcher shop for the last four years. He is married and has four children.  He is working as teacher in the local school but his main income is generated from selling meat.  He dreams to open one more butcher shop.  He thinks he can afford it as his older son is also helping him a lot.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for sale in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick K., 39 years old, is a father of four children aged between two and twelve years. He is a resident of Litein Town where he has been operating a dairy for six years.

Fredrick has applied for this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He had previously acquired two loans of 30,000 KES and 40,000 KES. He hopes the proceeds from this loan will be enough to educate his children. He plans to put up a dairy unit and maintain only pure breeds in his farm.

He is very appreciative of Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida B. is 8 years old woman who breeds cattle in the Internally Displaced People Settlement for the last 8 years.  She usually purchases small cattle, raises and fattens them before selling them to the local butchers.  She also sells milk and yoghurt to make additional income.  

Currently she has 3 cows.  She applied for a loan to purchase one milk cow.  Khalida belies this will allow her to increase her income to be able take care of her five children.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Yeremiah

texts.en: Yeremiah is a 54-year-old married man with three children, living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His goal is to set up income-generating activities for each of his children. He trades in goats and has been in the business for two years, reaping great profits. His major challenges are the markets are far (apart), and he has limited capital to meet the demands of his customers. Yeremiah would like to set up a ranch in the future. He needs the loan to purchase goats to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing goats for sale

loans.name: Mwanambahazi

texts.en:
Mwanambahazi is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

She sells clothes, hand bags, shoes and Kikoi’s from home to her neighbours and passersby.  Mwanambahazi faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation incurred during transportation of goods from the market to her place of operation.  She hopes to open a boutique someday.

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a bale of clothes, shoes, hand bags and Kikoi’s for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes, shoes, hand bags and Kikoi’s for resale.

loans.name: Musruf

texts.en: Musruf C., 46, is a farmer who has a small herd of sheep. He has 40 sheep and runs this business for the last four years. The business is very profitable and generates a stable income for his family. Musruf is married and has four children. Sheep breeding is the only financial source for his family. He is not alone in his business, as his brother also helps him in looking after the animals. He sells sheep to the local butchers or as meat. The mutton is very popular among Azerbaijani people and Musruf is going to expand his business and purchase more sheep. For this purpose, he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to buy 20 sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix tiene 59 años. Esta casado con doña Josefina Sotelo quien es ama de casa. Ellos tienen tres hijos mayores de edad.
 Don Félix es propietario de un camión en el cual realiza trabajos de taxi carga o flete. 
Se dedica a esta actividad desde el año 1982. 
Inicialmente trabajaba como chofer para otros taxi cargas, hasta que con ahorros y esfuerzo logró comprar para su camión y otro tiempo después también logró adquirir la para que actualmente ocupa en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.  
 Necesita de este crédito para realizar un mantenimiento general a su camión, pues este constituye su herramienta principal de trabajo. 
 Don Félix desea servir siempre de ejemplo a sus hijos y nietos, mostrándolas  el valor del trabajo. 
También poder heredar a estos su camión y parada para que puedan generar sus ingresos de forma independiente como el siempre lo hizo.
texts.en:
Felix is 59 years old.  He is married to Josefina Sotelo who is a housewife.  They have three adult children.  
Felix owns a pick-up truck and has been providing cargo and package delivery services since 1982.  
Initially, he worked as a driver for other cargo and package delivery service providers.  Then, by working hard and saving his money, he was able to buy a truck. Later, he was also able to acquire the taxi stand he currently occupies in the city of San Lorenzo.
He needs this loan for general maintenance on his truck because this is his primary tool for operating his business.
Felix wants to always be an example to his children and grandchildren, showing them the value of work.
Also, he wants to be able to pass his truck and taxi stand on to his children so that they can generate income independently the same way he has always done.

loans.use: Truck maintenance

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham H. is engaged in manufacturing and preparing orders working with iron. He has seven years of experience in this field. He is married and has two children. Ilham's son actively helps him in this business. Ilham has a lot of orders but he is not able financially to purchase sufficient iron to accept all orders and for this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. Ilhan also would like to rent a bigger place to work. He promises to repay accurately and believes that this loan will increase his income and number of clients, which will allow him to improve his life and the lives of his children.

loans.use: To purchase more iron materials and rent a bigger place to work.

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram I., 23, is a farmer who raises sheep in the Internally Displaced People Settlement. He gained experience from his father who is also a farmer but has decided to have his own farm only a year ago. Now he has 30 sheep and spends all day looking after his herd. It is not easy to look after 30 sheep alone, pasturing them every day and vaccinating and his brother actively helps him in this hard job. Now, Bayram has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy 10 more sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: Mobateli Plus Group

texts.en: Freddy has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2008. He runs a telephone booth, sells soft drinks and manages a barber shop to the east of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience in these areas and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large drugstore in his environment. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his businesses, which bring in US $50 of profit each week. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals. Freddy is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having six times received and correctly repaid loans. He will purchase with his next loan a freezer to sell cold drinks preferred by his customers and increase the profits. Freddy is 32 years old and single.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer in order to sell cold soft drinks.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John G. is 61 years old and has six children aged between 21 and 40 years old. He is a resident of Murang'a in Central Kenya. He has been farming for forty years, producing maize, beans, milk and chicken and selling them in the local market. His challenges are animal diseases and the high cost of animal feed.

John has applied for this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. He believes the loan will improve his household income and help him achieve his long-term dream of running well-established poultry and dairy farms. He hopes to increase his working capital to over 200,000 KES in five years.

He is urging Juhudi Kilimo to increase loans advanced to clients to 500,000 KES and assist them in the purchase of land.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Mwanabena

texts.en:
Mwanabena is a married woman with eight children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates an open air food market from home, selling to her neighbours and to school children. Mwanabena faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season, it becomes difficult to sell in an open place. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future.

With the 50,000 Kshs loan, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 20 years old, single and working and living in Saida, in the south of Lebanon. For two years Ali has been operating an auto repair workshop, during which time his business has grown steadily. While he didn't have many customers to start with, he is now very popular and has a good number of clients who are his friends and neighbours. Ali is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to purchase tools and stock for his auto repair workshop, and in the future hopes to be able to buy his own workshop premises.

loans.use: Buy tools & stock for his workshop

loans.name: Tubhuke Group

texts.en:
Bhoke J. is in her late twenties and is married with one daughter (in the picture Bhoke is fourth from left in the second row). Bhoke is a primary school teacher, but on the side she runs a small clothing shop in order to make ends meet. Bhoke started her clothing shop two years ago. The shop is open between 9:00 A.M. and 4:00 P.M. and earns Bhoke a low monthly profit.

This will be Bhoke's fourth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Bhoke used her previous loans to increase her stock in clothes and to add some variety and new products to her shop. All these loans have since been successfully repaid. With this loan, Bhoke aims to start taking her clothes to the nearby city of Morogoro and selling them there on the weekends. Bhoke's dream is to build her own little school from where she can teach primary education.

Bhoke will share this loan with her loan group, Thubuke, which totals sixteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

loans.use: To start taking clothes to Morogoro

loans.name: Gédéon Plus Group

texts.en:
Nzeki, aged 43, is the manager of the community bank named Gédéon Plus. It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Nzeki has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2007. She runs a restaurant. Her business is the eastern part of Kinshasa. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI (microfinance institution) HOPE RDC, having six times obtained and correctly repaid loans. 

With her next loan, she is planning to increase the restaurant’s stock by buying three boxes of salted fish, chickens, two 50kg sacks of corn and manioc flour and vegetable oil with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $100 per week. 

Nzeki’s ambition is to enlarge her restaurant and open a general store. She is divorced and the mother of three children whose ages range between 20 and 22 years old. Two of them attend school. She is also taking care of her mother.

loans.use: To increase the restaurant’s stock by buying three boxes of salted fish, chickens, two 50kg sacks of corn and manioc flour

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 25-year-old enterprising man. He is married with two children and lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years. He has had tremendous improvement in his business, first a shop in a village and later advanced to town. 

Daniel needs the loan to buy a hundred sacks of maize for sale.

loans.use: Buying a hundred sacks of maize

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 47 years old and is married with two children who are 13 and 21 years old. Her husband is a teacher. Christine sells bread and tea in the Kabuga district of Rwanda. Christine has been running her restaurant for one year and she employs two people. Christine's restaurant is known in the area and well-organized.

Christine has requested this loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business and purchase more bread and tea. With her increased stock she will be able to attract more customers and earn more profit. She hopes she will be able to build her own house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more bread and tea for sale in shop

loans.name: Facundo

texts.es:
El señor  Facundo G. V. tiene 45 años de edad, casado con la señora Emiliana Campos tienen 6 hijos dependientes que estudian en nivel primario y secundario, la familia vive en la Comunidad de Corani Pampa hacia el norte de Colomi más de 15 años.
