El señor Facundo G. y su esposa se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, locoto anualmente que  llevan a comercializar los días de feria semanal de Colomi, también tienen 15 cabezas de ganado vacuno de engorde los utiliza en las faenas agrícolas y 5 lecheras, el señor Facundo se apersono a solicitar un crédito para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) más productos agroquímicos para mejorar sus cultivos del locoto. Lo cual el nos comenta que el año pasado se encontró en de mal estado de salud, ahora el dice que su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida y tener mejores ingresos a futuro para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Facundo G. Vallarroel is forty-five, married to Emiliana Campos, and has six young children in primary and secondary school.  The family has lived in the Corani Pampa community to the north of Colomi for more than fifteen years.

Facundo G. and his wife earn their living by growing potatoes and locoto peppers every year.  They take their product to sell on Colomi weekly fair days. They also have fifteen head of beef cattle that they use for farm work, and five milk cows.  Facundo has come seeking a loan to buy organic fertilizer (poultry manure), and more agrochemical products to improve his locoto pepper harvest, which he tells us was poor last year.  He says that now he dreams of a better quality of life and having more income in the future for his whole family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his agriculture business.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a young woman from Rafah City in Gaza Strip. She is a mother of three daughters and two sons. Mahmoud, Sahar's husband, is a Palestinian National Authority employee. The family own a perfumery store selling herbs, oils and traditional treatments.

Sahar took a loan from FATEN to purchase large amounts of herbs and oils to increase production and answer the growing demand for such products.
The loan will help the family increase their returns and enhance the family's living situation.

Sahar's husband appears in the picture here because Sahar is a conservative woman like most Gaza Strip citizens. 

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase herbs and oils to sell in the perfumery store

loans.name: Saleh

texts.ar:
صالح عمره 38 سنة يعمل في محل للزجاج تعهدات زجاج ابواب وشبابيك يعمل فيها منذ اكثر من 17 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يحب عائلته ويريد
لها العيش الكريم يهدف الى تطوير نفسه وتحسين وضع عائلته لم يواجه اي صعوبة في المصلحة الا نقص المادة يسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى 
شراء بضاعة زجاج ولوازم تعهدات لتوسيع المصلحة والاعتماد على الذات يطور بعمله كثيرا لذلك له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه وغيره طموح يتميز بعمله بالجودة
texts.en: Saleh is a 38-year-old husband and father of three who loves his family very much and wants to improve their lives. For the past seventeen years, he has been employed at a shop specializing in window and glass door contracting, with customers comprising of his neighbors and colleagues, among others. The only difficulty he has ever faced in his work has been a lack of financial resources. Accordingly, Saleh is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase glass supplies to further expand his business and become more self-reliant. Saleh is very driven and always produces quality work.

loans.use: To purchase glass supplies for business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 33-year-old married man with three children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. He longs to see his wife and children having all their basic needs met, such as food, shelter and security. 

He owns a video library and has been in the business for ten years, starting as an employee and then starting his own business. However, his business faces financial challenges. Richard needs the loan to buy current videos to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: Buying current videos to meet the demands of his customers

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Eleuterio G. H. es de 32 años de edad conviviente hace años con la señora Leonarda Miranda Angulo tienen 3 hijos dependientes de diferentes edades que estudian en nivel primaria, viven en Colomi calle López y López entre Aroma zona Barrientos área urbano, se dedican a la actividad agrícola, aparte tiene 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno que los tiene como de engorde; El señor Eleuterio G. y su esposa se alquilaban yunta cabezas de ganado vacuno para utilizar en las faenas agrícolas. 

Por esa razón se acercaron a consultarnos para sacar un préstamo para comprar dos cabezas de ganado vacuno (yunta)  así poder economizar sus ingresos y aumentar su producción agrícola, por ultimo nos cuenta que a partir de ahora mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia hacia el futuro.
texts.en:
Eleuterio G. H. is 32 years old.  He has lived with his partner Leonarda Miranda Angulo for years and they have 3 dependent children who are studying in elementary school.  The family lives in Colomi, in Barrientos district, an urban area.  They are farmers and have 4 heads of cattle besides those which they keep in order to fatten.  Eleuterio G. and his wife hire out yoked cattle to use in farming work.

For this reason, they came to see us about taking out a loan to buy two heads of cattle (yoke) so that they could save up their income and increase their agricultural production.  Finally, Eleuterio G. tells us that, from now into the future, his family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle

loans.name: Rose Aba Bagyina

texts.en:
Rose Aba Bagyina E. is divorced and has six dependants. She is a baker at Abura. She regularly bakes bread and other pastries. She sees to the general well-being of her family.

Rose will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to bake bread for sale. With the increased profits from her expanded business Rose plans to reinvest in her bread business.

loans.use: Rose will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to bake bread for sale

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a mother of one daughter. Her daughter is a young school student. Maha's husband Ibrahim is a water distribution vehicle driver. Maha's husband signed a contract with a water company in his area to work in water distribution on a percentage they have agreed on, and now he is covering all life expenses from its returns.

Maha came to FATEN and took a loan as her husband wants to fix the vehicle and replace the tires.

Maha's husband appear in the picture here because his wife is, like almost all Gaza Strip inhabitants, conservative.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the culturA. context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principA. loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To fix a water distribution vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Emelia Adjoa Yafoa

texts.en:
Emelia Adjoa Yafoa A. is married to a farmer and together they live with their six dependants. Emelia is a baker at Abura. She also sells slippers. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Emelia will add the loan to her existing income to expand her business by buying more slippers for sale. With the increased profits from her expanded business Emelia plans to build a shop.

loans.use: Emelia will add the loan to her initial income to expand her business by buying more slippers for sale

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité San Miguel nace hace  más de 3 años gracias al interés de varias señoras que ya tenían experiencia en comités,  las que decidieron formar un comité nuevo entre vecinas residentes en Guarambare. 
Lograron formar un comité en el que la disciplina y el respeto a las normas del comité son una regla indiscutible.
 Se reúnen todos los domingos en la casa de la coordinadora de finanzas. 
La Presidenta quien es la señora Ines, por ejemplo se dedica a varias cosas pero su ingreso principal es la venta de ropas usadas que la muy bien en cuanto a la venta ya que el precio es mucho menor que las prendas nuevas y trabaja en su propia casa gracias.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropas usadas.
texts.en:
The San Miguel committee was founded 3 years ago thanks to the interest of a number of ladies who already had experience in such committees.  They decided to form a new committee made up of a group of female neighbors from Guarambare.

The women have managed to form a committee in which discipline and respect of the committee's regulations are an unquestionable rule.

The group meets every Sunday in the financial coordinator's house.

The group's president is Ines.  She has a number of business activities but her main source of income is selling used clothes.  Her business is doing very well in terms of sales because her prices are much lower than those for new clothes and she works in her own home.

Ines is requesting a loan to buy bundles of used clothes.

loans.use: To buy bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Yaa Bruwah Cecilia

texts.en:
Yaa Bruwah Cecilia A. sells Fante kenkey at Abura. She is married and has seven dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare Fante kenkey for sale. She wishes to reinvest her  capital back into her business. 

Yaa is standing by a barrel full of Fante kenkey. She has a sample of it in her hand alsot.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare Fante kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac O. is 32 years old, married and the father of three children, aged between 3-6, with one attending school. Isaac has been in mixed farming for ten years. He sells maize, beans, bananas, tea and milk locally.

With this loan of 25,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, Isaac will buy a dairy cow. The proceeds will help pay school fees and improve family living standards in terms of food and wealth. In five years, Isaac hopes to increase the dairy cows to five. Isaac's major challenges are the low market prices for milk and farm produce and the poor road network which interferes with daily transportation. He thanks Juhudi for the financing and hopes for more.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Agnes Efua Kokoh

texts.en:
Agnes Efua Kokoh T. sells cooked and uncooked rice at Abura. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in taking care of their family. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy extra bags of rice to cook and sell. She hopes to use the increased profits from her business to build a shop.

Agnes is pictured above showing a sample of the rice she sells.

loans.use: The loan she is requesting will be used to buy extra bags of rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Efua Egyirma Mercy

texts.en:
Efua Egyirma Mercy K. is a baker at Abura. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan will be used to buy more ingredients to bake and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children's education. 

Efua is removing the bread she had baked for the morning from her traditionally built overn.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake

loans.name: Florence Ewura Akua

texts.en:
Florence Ewura Akua N. sells provisions at Abura. She is married and has eight dependants. Florence uses the income she makes from her sales to assist her husband in taking care of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to expand her shop. With her increased profit she hopes to buy some land.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to expand her shop

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad A. B. is from A. Ashrafia, Jordan. He is 24 years old and owns a cereals and herbs shop. Ahmad started his business three years ago with a very humble beginning, struggling to keep his doors open!

In 2007, with his continuous hard-work and unlimited ambitions, Ahmad started his business with the necessary cereals and herbs product, opening his first store.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 1500 JD (2113 USD), which will be used to purchase additionA. raw materials and increase capitA. to expand his business.

Ahmad is passionate about his work, and nothing will stand in his way of fulfilling his dreams and ambitions. Now he is looking to open a new store and import the needed raw materials from Africa.

loans.use: To buy raw materials (cereals and herbs) to expand his business

loans.name: Robert Valois

texts.es:
El señor Robert Valois H. T. tiene 33 años de edad y vive en casa de sus tios en el barrio San Geronimo de esta ciudad de Tarija. Robert es soltero y no tiene hijos. El señor Robert se dedica desde hace mas de 3 años a trabajar como chofer de flotas en la empresa expreso del sur realizando viajes a todo el país también en sus días libres trabaja como taxista.  Robert quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante, pero él nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar un vehículo propio. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para pagar una parte para la compra del vehículo de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos y en lugar de pagar el alquiler del vehículo pagara el crédito que solicita.
                                                                         
                                                                                                                  Robert nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en: Robert Valois H. T. is 33 years old and lives in his aunt and uncle's house in the San Geronimo neighborhood of the city of Tarija.  Robert is single and doesn't have any children.  For more than 3 years he has been working as a fleet driver for the company “Expreso del Sur”, travelling throughout the country.  In his free time he also works as a taxi driver.  Robert would like to make better profits so that he can get ahead in life but he tells us that he needs money to buy his own vehicle.  For this reason, his loan will be used to pay part of the cost of buying a vehicle.  This way he will be able to increase his profits and instead of paying to hire his vehicle, he will pay back his loan instead.

loans.use: To pay the balance on buying his own vehicle

loans.name: Sophia Efua Tuaba

texts.en: Sophia Efua Tuaba E. sells materials, sandals and cosmetics at Abura. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for 14 years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics to sell. She hopes to build a shop from her additional profit.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 58-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She sells a wide range of goods from her home to customers from her community. She has been involved in this occupation from the past six years.  She sells oil, olives etc. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory for the coming winter season. Her business depends largely on the seasons and she needs to be prepared before the winter.  She believes that her business would fare better if she were to sell her goods in a different part of Lebanon. In the future, she would like to rent out a space to sell her merchandise, as well as sell popular homemade food products. For the time being, she will continue to sell goods from her home.

loans.use: To increase her inventory for the coming winter season

loans.name: Neema-Kimara Group

texts.en:
Sada M. is in her mid-forties and is married with three children. Sada runs a fruit and vegetable stall from which she sells tomatoes and onions. She has been doing this since 2000. The stall is open between 6:30 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. and earns Sada a low monthly profit.

This will be Sada's third Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Sada used her previous loans to increase her stock of onions. These loans have since been successfully repaid. With this loan, Sada aims to increase her stock of tomatoes as well. Sada's dream is to one day buy a sewing machine and start making her own clothing.

Sada will share this loan with her loan group Neema-Kimara, which totals 21 members, who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. In the photo, Sada can be seen in the first row, wearing a black blouse and a pink head cover.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Everlove Abena Ewusiewah

texts.en: Everlove Abena Ewusiewah M. is married and has a child. Everlove is a hairdresser in Abura. She also sells cosmetics by moving from one area to another. Her husband is an auto mechanic. She uses her income to assist her husband in educating and feeding the family. Everlove will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Everlove plans to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever vive en casa de su hermana en la zona Llojeta, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero, el señor trabaja en la construcción en viviendas particulares, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene, es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.

El crédito que solicita es para la construcción de una habitación en la casa de su hermana, para poder vivir más confortablemente, pues actualmente está incomodo.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ever is single and lives in his sister’s home in the Llojeta zone, of the city of La Paz.  He does construction in private homes and supports himself with this income.  This is his first loan request.

He is asking for this loan in order to build a room in his sister’s home, so that he can live more comfortably, since he is not very comfortable now.

His socioeconomic status qualifies him for a new loan.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Wendel Wolcenth

texts.es: El Señor Wendel dedicado a la producción de mermeladas y dulce de leche este es un negocio que emprende ya hace 3 años atrás, una vez realizado el producto este lo ofrece en las diferentes Provincias del departamento, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos que hoy por hoy subieron los precios por los cielos y una heladera nueva para poder mantener refrigerados sus productos, el deseo del señor es iniciar su micro empresa y así fortalecer sus ventas para poder ayudar a su familia con una mejor calidad de vida, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Wendel makes jellies and candy (dulce de leche), has been in this business for three years, and sells his products within the different provinces in the department.  He will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients whose prices have recently gone sky high. He will also buy a new refrigerator to keep his products cool.  His desire is to start a small company and increase his sales so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.  He is very grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: Ingredients and a refrigerator

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. smokes fish and then sells the smoked fish in Abura. She is a widow who cares for five dependants. Esi has been selling smoked fish for ten years. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy different kinds of fish to smoke so she can supply an increasing number of customers. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fish to smoke

loans.name: Ekua Awoyie Mary

texts.en: Ekua Awoyie Mary E. is a widow who has three children. Ekua sells fruits, such as bananas, in Abura. She has been in this trade for three years. Ekua uses her income to see to the well-being of her family. She is going to use the loan she is requesting for to expand her fruit business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to buy land.

loans.use: To expand her fruit business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 42 años de edad,es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia vende en el mercado de San Pedro de Cusco todos los dias, este es el medio por el cual saca a sus hijos adelante.   

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas insumos para su negocio como arroz,verduras y menestras.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 42 años de edad,es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia vende en el mercado de San Pedro de Cusco todos los dias, este es el medio por el cual saca a sus hijos adelante.   

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas insumos para su negocio como arroz,verduras y menestras.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Alberta Abena Aku

texts.en: Alberta Abena Aku Q. is married to a farmer and lives with her two children. Alberta sells shoes and slippers in Abura, a job that she has been doing for the past three months. She assists her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to purchase more shoes and slippers to sell. Alberta is hoping to use her additional income to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Llojeta, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su madre y su hermana de 15 años; es soltera y trabaja como educadora de nivel primario en un centro de ayuda social de su zona, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos. El dinero será utilizado para demoler una antigua habitación hecha de adobe, que se encuentra fuera de la línea municipal, y construir una nueva habitación de ladrillo en la casa de sus padres.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Lidia lives with her mother and 15 year old sister, parents in the Llojeta zone of La Paz.  She’s single, works as a teacher in a social assistance center in her zone, and supports herself with this income.

This is her first loan request and she will use the money to raze an old adobe house outside the city limits and build a new brick home.  Her socioeconomic situation qualifies her for this loan.

loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Wildie Ama Kwakoah

texts.en:
Wildie Ama Kwakoah E. is a widow who cares for seven dependants. She cooks and sells banku (corn dough dumplings served with hot soup) in Abura. She is responsible for the general welfare of her home. She is requesting a loan to expand her banku business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Wildie plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

In the photograph, Wildie had finished selling the banku she made for the morning. She is showing a sample of the corn dough she uses for the banku.

loans.use: To expand her banku business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de San Pedro, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y trabaja atendiendo una librería, con cuyos ingresos se mantiene.

Con un anterior crédito realizó la refacción de dos habitaciones en su vivienda. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para construir un garaje en la casa donde vive.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito; se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Wilson lives with his parents in the San Pedro Zone of the city of La Paz.  He is single, works in a bookstore, and supports himself with this income.

He used the money from the previous loan to make repairs to two rooms in his home and he is satisfied with the loans he has received.  He is asking for this loan in order to build a garage in his home.

His credit history qualifies him for this loan and he is considered to be a good customer.

loans.use: Build a garage

loans.name: Lesimon Ole

texts.en:
Lesimon Ole M. is 32 years old. He is married to Nataana Ene Butu, and he is a father of five school-going children. Lesimon is a tomato farmer in the Narok area, and he has been doing this for the last eight years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his third loan, which he is planning to use on his twenty acres of tomatoes to buy the fertilizers and chemicals he needs. He is also planning to buy young sheep for fattening and later will sell them at a profit. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to acquire more land for farming to increase his production and educate his children.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more tomatoes for commercial purposes and also build a house for renting. He describes himself as a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers. He is also planning to buy young sheep for fattening and selling them later.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de refrescos y golosinas. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio es una persona muy responsable como padre responsable tiene que mantener a su esposa y sus 4 hijos que están a su cargo. El inicio este negocio cuando se quedo sin trabajo, ya que necesitaba la forma de cómo generar ingresos a su hogar, fue así que adquirió este medio de vida. El crédito será invertido en la compra de frutas, hielo, bolsas, pajillas y azúcar para la elaboración y venta. Sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jesús is 45 years old and sells snacks and drinks.  He’s been in this business for more than 20 years and is a very responsible person.  As a responsible father, he must support his wife and four children.

He started this business when he lost his job and needed a way to earn an income.  He will use the money from this loan to invest in the purchase of fruits, ice, bags, drinking straws, and sugar so that he can make and sell his products.  He wants to move his children ahead and also expand his business.

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La Señora Felipa vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos ella se dedica a la venta de productos Dietéticos quien se dedico a esto porque ella se encontraba enferma y una de sus amigas le recomendó este producto y le hizo bien es por ese motivo que la señora se dedico a esta actividad  su esposo también se encontraba con sobrepeso y tomo este producto ahora se encuentra delgado y saludable. La señora saco el préstamo para comprar mas productos ya que tiene bastante pedido de este, le va bien con esta actividad y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Felipa lives with her husband and children in a home of their own.  She sells dietary products because she found herself sick one day and a friend recommended these products to her, which helped her get well.  This motivated her to enter this business.  Her husband, who was overweight, also used the products and he is now thin and healthy.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy more products, since she gets plenty of requests from her customers.  Her business is doing well and she is grateful for the support she has gotten from this institution.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 55 años de edad, es viuda  y tiene 01 hijo ; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,aceite,azúcar,leche entre otros,la socia lo vende de forma ambulatoria en el   mercado San Pedro. 

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas productos para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Hatun Soncco” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Rosa is 55 years old, is a widow and has one son. 

She sells primary need products, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, milk, among other things, on foot in the San Pedro market.  She is asking for this loan so that she can buy more items for her business.

She is grateful to those who help make this dream possible through this means and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Pelegrin M. is in his early sixties and is a musician. He is married with six children and has been working as a musical performer for the past six years. Pelegrin works daily between 6:00 pm and 1:00 am, and his job earns him a low monthly profit.

This will be Pelegrin's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Pelegrin used his previous loan to buy an amplifier. This loan has since been successfully repaid. With his second loan, Pelegrin aims to purchase two microphones and a crossover machine. His dream is to one day open a studio from where he can produce his own music.

Pelegrin will share this loan with his loan group, Royal, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Pelegrin can be seen on the far right in the front row wearing suspenders.

loans.use: To buy Two mikes and crossover machine.

loans.name: Maame Serwaa Cecilia

texts.en: Maame Serwaa Cecilia M. operates a grocery store in Abura. She is divorced and cares for four children. She has been in this business for two years. She is responsible for providing for the basic needs of her family such as food, clothing and shelter. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries so she can expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Afif

texts.ar:
عفيف في عمر 51 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع الدجاج له في المهنة حوالي 20 سنة متزوج وله 2 اولاد  يحب عائلته ويلقى منها الدعم الدائم
متطور يحب عمله ويطوره باستمرار من خلال معرفته لمحيطه العملي لكن ما ينقص لزيادة البضائع والمعدات هو الماال لذلك هو يطلب قرض من المجموعة 
بهدف شراء بضائع جديدة ومكنة للدجاج ليس لديه رأس مال كافي ليطور المصلحة له زبائن يقصدونه لانه معروف  بالاتقان والنظافة في العمل
texts.en: Afif is a 51-year-old husband and father-of-two who loves his family and in turn receives considerable support from them. For the past two decades, Afif has been working at a poultry shop, where many customers come to give their patronage because of his reputation for quality products and keeping a clean shop. He also uses his tight relationship with his customers to continually develop his circle of clients. Nevertheless, Afif lacks sufficient capital to expand his business, and hence would like to turn to Al Majmoua for a loan to purchase a poultry processor and other commodities for his shop.

loans.use: Purchase poultry processor and other commodities for poultry shop

loans.name: Akwata Empola Gambwa Women's Group A-Mityana

texts.en: Retailing has been 30-year-old N. Lukia's business occupation for the last 10 years in Gambwa-Mityana. At her premise, she predominately sells rice, beans, maize flour, etc. Before the inception of this business, she had a penchant for farming. She has not dispensed with her farming enterprise notwithstanding. She still finds time to go and tend to her crops and gardens, though much time is spent at her retail shop. This hardworking mother of 4 says weekly her profits are 100,000 shillings. With this loan she is looking at buying more retail items such as sugar, bread, maize flour, etc. for reselling. Lukia belongs to Akwata Empola Gambwa Group-Mityana.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail items such as sugar, maize flour, bread, etc., for reselling

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres vive en casa propia en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La paz con su hija menor; es viudo, tiene 74 años de edad y tiene un auto con el cual trabaja en transporte publico con el cual genera sus ingresos para subsistir.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar el motor y algunas otras partes de la movilidad que están fallando.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Andres lives with his young daughter in his own home within the Tembladerani zone of La Paz.  He is a 74 year old widower who uses his car to provide transportation services in order to generate income.

He will use the money from this loan to repair the engine and other parts of the car that have failed.

He has been an IMPRO client with a good payment record and is approved for a new loan.

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Cecilia Ama Kakraba

texts.en: Cecilia Ama Kakraba A. is married and has five dependants. Cecilia sells raw rice that has been bagged in small quantities in Abura. She also sells different types of soaps. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan will be used to purchase varieties of soaps to sell. Cecilia wishes to use the additional income to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of soaps to sell

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school while two graduated from school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense are school fees.

For over eleven years, she has operated a restaurant business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  Mwanamkasi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to expand her restaurant in the future. 

With the 80,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar and furniture (chairs and tables) for her restaurant. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar and furniture (chairs and tables) for her restaurant.

loans.name: Agnes Ekua Korankyewaa

texts.en:
Agnes Ekua korankyewaa A. sells banku (corn dumplings eaten in hot soup) and maize in Abura.  Agnes has no educational background. She is divorced and has one child. She is responsible for the welfare of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to sell and to use in cooking banku, which she also sells. She hopes to reinvest her new profits.

In this picture, Agnes is displaying the maize she sells and cooks.

loans.use: To buy maize to sell and use in banku

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct another room  and purchase chairs for the classroom.

loans.name: Ama Abokyi Joyce

texts.en: Ama Abokyi Joyce Q. is a dressmaker and poultry farmer in Abura. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan she is requesting for will be used to buy poultry feed for her chickens. She hopes to reinvest her new profits.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed for her chickens

loans.name: Florence Maame Yaa Anobona

texts.en: Florence Maame Yaa Anobona A. is married and has six dependants. She sells fruit, such as bananas and oranges, in Abura. She has been doing this work for five years. Her husband is a security man. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Florence will use the loan to purchase more fruit to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence hopes to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Ekua Osumah Magaret

texts.en: Ekua Osumah Magaret A. bakes bread for sale in Abura. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a blacksmith. She helps her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to do some large-scale baking. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 48 años de edad,casada  y tiene 3 hijos ; La socia  se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas en su casa , luego lo distribuye a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado donde es recepcionado por una de sus amigas , a la vez la socia trabaja en un colegio nacional en la provincia de Acomayo como docente.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como maíz,verduras entre  otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Margarita belongs to the “Hatun Soncco” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Margarita is 48 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens in her home.  She then sells them in the town of Puerto Maldonado where she is put up by one of her friends.  Margarita also works in a school in Acomayo province as a teacher.

Margarita is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies for her business such as corn and vegetables.

She is grateful to those who will take part in this dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business such as corn and vegetables

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es transportista publico de trufi inter ciudad La Paz-El Alto. Tiene dos hijos, vive en casa alquilada en la zona Santiago II de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito que solicita es para cubrir el costo de conversión de gasolina a Gas Natural Vehicular, lo cual le permitirá un ahorro de alrededor de un 60% en el combustible, logrando mejorar sus ingresos.

 Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y el primer vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Jorge is a public transport driver.  He drives a minibus on the La Paz-El Alto intercity route.  He has two children and lives in a rented house in the Santiago II district of the city of El Alto.

Jorge's loan is to cover the cost of converting his vehicle from gas to natural gas which will allow him to make a saving of around 60% in his fuel consumption which will improve his income.

This is his first loan with IMPRO and his first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: To convert his public transport vehicle from gas to natural gas

loans.name: Karin Erica

texts.es: La Señora Karin Es  Secretaria y También se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos,  vive con sus papas quienes le ayudan con la alimentación ya que gana poco trabaja como secretaria en una empresa pero ella aprovecha también para vender cosméticos por catalogo ya que tiene bastantes conocidos y eso le ayuda para sus gastos personales y gastos familiares porque su mama no trabaja y su papa recibe un sueldo como rentista y es por eso que ella les ayuda en algunos gastos de su casa, es joven y muy trabajadora, el dinero del crédito es para la compra de cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción y así ella poder vender un poco mas elevado y tener mas ingresos.
texts.en: La Señora Karin is a secretary and she also sells cosmetics.  She lives with her parents who help her with food since she doesn't make much working as a secretary for a business.  She sells cosmetics by catalog since she knows a lot of people and this helps her with her personal and family expenses because her mother doesn't work and her father receives a salary from investments.  This is why she helps them with some of the household expenses.  She is young and hardworking.  The loan is to buy cosmetics that are on sale and therefore sell them at a slightly higher price and have more income.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Lidia Mercedes

texts.es: Lidia Mercedes tiene 33 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 12 años que busca la forma de mantener a su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Es una mujer muy luchadora y que disfruta de su actividad y así disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes, fue por una amiga que inicio este medio de vida pues al ver que proporcionaba ciertas ganancias a su hogar. El destino del crédito es para la compra de materia prima como ropa en general, toallas, sabanas, calzado y cosméticos.
texts.en: Lidia Mercedes is 33 and has sold general merchandise for a living for 12 years as a way to support her family since she is a single mother of 4 young children.  She is a spirited woman who enjoys her work and enjoys interacting with her customers.  She got into this business because of a friend.  She saw how her friend earned some income for her home.  The loan is to purchase raw materials like clothing, towels, bedspreads, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar:
حسن عمره 43 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في تعهدات الكهرباء للمنازل والمكاتب وغيره له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عمله وهدفه
ان يعلم اولاده في مستوى عال وايضا محب لعمله كثيرا ويهدف الى انشاء مصلحة خاصة له من خلال فتح محل خاص لذلك يطلب قرض من المجموعة
بهدف فتح محل كهرباء عامة لأنه يعمل متجول وهو يهدف الى الاستقرار في عمله وبيته طموح محبوب في محيطه العملي ولكنه يلقى منافسة عالية
لأنه يسكن في منطفة شعبية يحتاج الى المال لكي يرقى عن مستوى التنافس العادي  عائلته تدعمه دائما وتساعده لتخطي الصعاب العملية التي يمر بها
texts.en: Hasan is a 43-year-old husband and father-of-three who receives a lot of support from his family and who in turn wants to make sure that his children are given an excellent education. For the past fifteen years, Hasan has worked as an itinerant electrician for homes and offices, a field which he finds engaging. He is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to set up his own electrician’s shop so that he can achieve some sort of stability. Although he is very well-liked by his customers, he nevertheless faces stiff competition given that he is operating in a working-class district; hence he needs more capital to be able to rise above the rest.

loans.use: Set up own electrician's shop

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 53 años de edad,casada y tiene 4hijos ; La socia tiene su negocio de kiosko el cual se encuentra ubicado en el instituto de Arco Iris de Cusco,a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas en su casa para luego venderlo a sus amistades.  

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas productos para su negocio como dulces,galletas,caramelos,tortas,entre otros .

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Hatun Soncco Community Bank located in the Cuzco district of Cuzco. Mrs. Margarita is 53 years old, married, and has four children. She has a kiosk in the Rainbow Institute of Cuzco and also works at home raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens that she later sells to her friends.

She is asking for a loan to buy more products for her business, like candy, cookies, caramels, sandwiches, and others. She is thankful for all the people who help make her dream come true through these means and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Candy, cookies, caramels, sandwiches, etc.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 30-year-old inspired woman, married to an accountant. They have three children and live in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Harriet has had a retail shop for five years now and this business has helped her to pay school fees for her children. Harriet needs money to buy more sugar, soap and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and rice to sell

loans.name: Alain

texts.es: El Sr. Alain vive en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz es  casado, su esposa es empleada, su actividad es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, también esta estudiando en la universidad lo cual alterna el negocio con los estudio, con el fin de darle un futuro mejor a su familia, el destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería, por fin de año desea surtir su tienda con refrescos, dulces, galletas, chocolates, etc. , hace unos dos año que tiene el negocio,  viven en la casa de su madre a quien ayuda también con algunos gastos de la casa, es muy trabajador y su deseo es el de terminar sus estudios, esta muy agradecido con la institución con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Alain lives in the el Torneo area, 39 km from the city of Santa Cruz.  He is married and his wife is employed.  He sells staples and is also studying at the university, alternating his work and his studies, with the hope of providing his family with a better future.  The loan is to purchase merchandise.  For the new year, he would like to stock his business with sodas, sweets, cookies, chocolates, etc.  He has had his business for two years.  They live in his mother's house who they assist with household expenses.  He is a hard worker and wants to finish his studies.  He is very grateful for the institution and the support it provides.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayeta se formó hace un años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es del J.A. Saldivar , en estos un años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
 Han pasado por una prueba muy difícil en el ciclo anterior ya que dos de las compañeras incumplieron en los compromisos de pago semanal, cancelaron el crédito y asumieron el compromiso de levantar nuevamente y con éxito el comité al cual pertenecen. 
Para levantar el comite se encuentra en la cabeza la señora Laura quien una mujer muy emprendedora y capaz.
Ella realiza como trabajo para el ingreso familiar la venta de frutas y verduras desde un puesto que posee.
Es una actividad que a ella le conviene mucho, ya que todos los dias tiene buena venta.
Asi logró ayudar hasta hoy a su familia en muchos gastos de la casa, y solicita el prestamo con su comité para invertir en su negocio como las demas integrantes, desea adquirir, verduras y frutas del mercado como manzanas, cebollas, tomates, zanahorias, y otros.
texts.en:
The San Cayeta Group was formed a year ago with the support of another group that was working in the same place. This group is from J.A. Saldivar. Many years of hard work have allowed them to grow socially as well as economically and they are known in the area as very hard-working women. They had a challenging time with their last loan since two of their partners did not make their weekly payments. They canceled the loan and assumed the responsibility of successfully reforming their group.

Mrs. Laura has been the leader in restarting this group. She is a very entrepreneurial and capable woman. To support her family, she works selling fruits and vegetables from her own stand. It is a good business for her and every day she sells a lot. In this way, she has been able to help her family with a lot of the expenses of the home. She is asking for a loan with her group to invest in her business (just like the other members) and she desires to obtain vegetables and fruits from the market like apples, onions, tomatoes, carrots, and others.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, carrots, apples, pineapples, oranges, and more.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es: Jannet, de 35 años, está casada con Valerio, de 42 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos, a los que educa y cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Desde que era niña, sus padres le enseñaron el hermoso oficio de la artesanía, desde ese entonces hasta el día de hoy se convirtió en su principal pasatiempo y forma de trabajo y  hace 4 años abrió una pequeña tienda donde vende artesanía como: boinas, chompas, ponchos y chalinas tejidas. En el parque central de la población, es donde se instala la feria comercial, así que todos los meses de febrero, julio y octubre; los turistas visitan el “comercial artesanal”, donde se encuentra la tienda de Jannet. Ahora ella tiene planeado viajar a la ciudad de La Oroya, donde comercializará sus tejidos, con ello está segura que logrará incrementar su capital de trabajo, para poder invertirlo en su tienda de artesanías. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y como fundadora de su banco comunal, siente alegría por el progreso obtenido hasta el día de hoy. Con el crédito que obtendrá, le ayudará a comprar, madejas de lana de alpaca, que oscila entre los 25 soles cada una y si le alcanza comprará también adornos artesanales para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Jannet is 35 years old.  She is married to 42 year-old Valerio.  They have four children but only live with two of them who they are educating and raising in their own home which is located in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.

When she was a young girl, Jannet's parents taught her the beautiful trade of making handicrafts.  Since that time, this has become Jannet's main hobby and also her work.  Four years ago she opened a small store where she sells handicrafts such as knitted berets, sweaters, ponchos and scarves.

In the central park of her town, a commercial market is set up every February, July and October.  Tourists visit the "handicrafts market" where Jannet's store is located.  Jannet is planning to travel to the city of La Oroya where she will sell her knitted items.  This way she is sure that she will manage to increase her working capital which she can then invest in her handicrafts store.

This is Jannet's fifth loan from MFP and, as the founding member of her community bank, she feels happy with the progress she has made to date.  She will use her loan to help her buy skeins of alpaca wool which cost around 25 soles each and if she has enough left over she will also buy hand-made decorations to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool and hand-made decorations

loans.name: Canter Group

texts.en:
Hawa S. is in her mid-thirties and is married with three children. Hawa has been running a charcoal store since 2000. The store is open between 8:00 am to 9:00 pm and earns Hawa a fair monthly profit.

This will be Hawa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Hawa used her previous loan to increase her stock of charcoal and then started selling samosas. This loan has since been successfully repaid. With this loan, Hawa aims to increase her stock of charcoal and buy a sack of flour and cooking oil as well. Hawa's dream is to one day add another charcoal store.

Hawa will share this loan with her loan group, Canter, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Hawa can be seen first from right wearing a pink blouse and a colored headcover.

loans.use: To increase the charcoal stock for sale, plus purchase sacks of flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: El Sr. Abel  vive en la localidad de Puerto Rico, municipio de el Torno, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace uno 10 años que se vino a vivir a la ciudad, su actividad es el transporte de personas (taxi), el destino del crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que están terminando un cuarto en su vivienda, hace unos dos año que se dedica a la actividad del transporte urbano su esposa con la cual tiene dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, la cual le permite colaborar en la economía del hogar, es un apersona trabajadora y muy responsable esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Abel lives in Puerto Rico, in the town of El Torno.  He was born in Cochabamba department.  He came to live in the town 10 years ago.  His business is providing a taxi service.

Abel will use his loan to buy building materials since he is finishing off a room in his home.  He has been in the urban transport business for two years.  His wife, with whom he has two children, sells beauty products which allows her to contribute to the household finances.  Abel is a hard-working and very responsible man who is very grateful to the institution for the support he is receiving.

loans.use: To finish building his house

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 41 years old and married with five children between the ages of 5 and 18 years old. Her husband is a repairman. She runs a small boutique in the Kabuga district of Rwanda. She employs two people and her store is open from 6 am until 11 pm. Seraphine has 20 years of experience in this business. 

Seraphine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more products for her boutique. She hopes this loan will help her obtain more profit from her sales. With the extra profit, Seraphine plans to pay school fees for her children and save money for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, de 55 años, se separó de su esposa hace 10 años. Pero a pesar de sus constantes problemas se siente feliz de apoyar a sus 3 hijos, a los que cría y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Desde niño se dedicaba a la artesanía, y según afirma es el más completo trabajo de arte que todos, entre sus compañeros lo llaman el “múltiple”, ya que es artesano, escultor, pintor, agricultor y ganadero. Según menciona, ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a ello, sus principales tejidos constan de tapices cuyos dibujos son principalmente de motivos paisajísticos, asimismo elabora artesanía como, cucharones de madera, Huislash (esculturas) y, ahora está incursionando en la creación de chalinas de alpaca. Donde está teniendo gran éxito, por ello desde hace algún tiempo está tramitando los papeles necesarios para poder formalizar una empresa textil, donde pueda exportar y llevar más cantidad de sus productos, a las diferentes ferias del país. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y como fundador de su banco comunal, se siente orgulloso con los logros obtenidos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, le ayudará a comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus tejidos y objetos artesanales.
texts.en:
Mario is 55 years old.  He separated from his wife 10 years ago.  However, in spite of his constant problems, Mario feels happy to be supporting his 3 children who he raises and educates in his own home, which is located in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.

Mario has been making handicrafts since he was a young boy and he says that it is the most complete art which exists.  Amongst his friends, he is nicknamed 'múltiple' because he is a craftsman, a sculptor, a painter, a crop farmer and a livestock farmer.  He says that he has been in the handicrafts business for 20 years.  His main knitted items are tapestries depicting landscapes.  He also makes handicrafts such as wooden spoons, Huislash (sculptures) and he is now also starting to produce Alpaca scarves.  He is having a lot of success.  For this reason, he has for some time been preparing the necessary paperwork which will enable him to set up an official textile business so that he can export his products and take more of them to different markets around the country.

This is Mario's fifth loan with MFP and, as a founding member of his community bank, he feels proud with what he has achieved.  Mario will use his loan to buy the supplies he needs to make his knitted items and handicrafts.

loans.use: To buy wool and materials for knitting and producing handicrafts

loans.name: Rosa Candelaria

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años, vende mariscos crudos en la pate delantera de su casa. Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 20 años atrás comenzó a comprar pescados a un precio muy económico para venderlos en la playa ya que había fallecido su esposo y necesitaba mantener a sus hijos. Por esa buena decisión en la actualidad  vende la libra de pescado a $ 3.00, la libra de camarón a $ 3.50, langostas a $ 5.00 y trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 13h00pm con la ayuda de su hermana vende con más facilidad los mariscos. También ha comprado unas hieleras para almacenar los mariscos y que no se les dañen.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pescados, camarones, langostas para que sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere tener un local porque ahora tienen su negocio en la casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old.  She sells uncooked seafood in the front of her home.  She lives in Playas canton which is an Ecuadorean tourist destination, noted for its wide range of seafood.

Twenty years ago Rosa started buying fish cheaply so that she could sell them on the beach since her husband had died and she needed to support her children.  This was a good decision and she currently sells her fish for $3.00 a pound, prawns for $3.50 a pound and lobsters for $5.00 a pound.  She works from 6.00am to 1.00pm and her sister helps in her business.  She has also bought some coolers to store her seafood in so that they don't go off.

Rosa will use her loan to buy fish, prawns and lobsters so that her customers have a variety of products to buy.  In the future, she would like to have a premises for her business as her business is currently in her home.

loans.use: To buy prawns and fish

loans.name: Garasiyane

texts.en:
Garasiyane is 28 years old and is married. He runs a restaurant in the Kabuga district of Rwanda. He has had this business for two years and works from 6 am until 7 pm every day. 

Garasiyane has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more goods like eggs, Fanta, milk, etc. Garasiyane hopes to earn more profit which will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business and provide better financial stability for his family.

loans.use: To purchase milk, Fanta, eggs and other stock

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over twelve years, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling green vegetables and potatoes. In addition she has rental houses which contributes to her other source of income. Rehema faces a major challenge of seasonality. She hopes to expand and establish other rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to renovate a rental house and purchase cement and plaster. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To renovate a rental house and purchase cement and  plaster.

loans.name: C5608 Inyenyeri Group

texts.en:
The Inyenyeri Group is made up of four members and their leader is Emmanuel. He is 23 years old and single. Emmanuel owns a boutique in the Kabuga district of Rwanda. The store is open from 6 am until 8 pm every day. Emmanuel has five years' experience in this business. He has one employee and his store is well organized, clean and well known in his area. He is a jovial and hardworking man. With this loan, Emmanuel will purchase more food products and a fridge. Emmanuel hopes to renovate his house and provide food for his family with profits from the business.

This is the Inyenyeri Group's first loan from Kiva, requested through Vision Finance Company, and they will use it to purchase more products for their boutiques.

loans.use: To purchase food products and a fridge

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 49 años, está casado con Gloria, de 45 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Keny, de 12, Miguel, de 10 y Jorge, de 5 años. En unión familiar viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Desde niño, Cesar lleva en la sangre el arte y el gusto por la artesanía. Cuando tuvo 20 años, abrió su propio taller, donde tejé hasta hoy; alfombras, frazadas y telares, prendas que son exportadas hacía argentina, donde tienen una pequeña tienda en la capital del país, ahí es donde sus hijos lo ayudan en la venta diaria. Pero como todo hombre exitoso, también tienen una tienda de artesanía llamada “la casa del artesano”, que queda en la parque de su localidad. Ahí vende sus creaciones, durante los meses de febrero, junio y octubre; fechas donde hay muchas visitas de turistas. De la misma manera este hombre exitoso, también se dedica a hacer juegos pirotécnicos desde hace 3 años. Como su situación económica aumentó considerablemente, él quiere invertir a futuro en la apertura de una tienda de regalos. Es el primer crédito con MFP y, como integrante nuevo, de su banco comunal, está seguro que obtendrá muchos éxitos y logros. Con el crédito que obtendrá, le servirá para surtir la tienda de regalos como: platos descartables, vidrios de loza, que piensa vender en está campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Cesar is 49 years old.  He is married to Gloria who is 45.  They have 8 children but only live with 3 of them: 12 year-old Keny, 10 year-old Miguel and 5 year-old Jorge.  The family lives in their own home which is located in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.

Since he was a little boy, Cesar has carried in his blood the art and love of making handicrafts.  When he was 20 years old, he opened his own workshop where he currently still knits rugs and blankets and creates items on a loom.  These items are exported to Argentina.  They have a small store in the capital city.  There his children help him with his daily sales.

However, like every successful man, Cesar also has a handicrafts store called “la casa del artesano” (the craftsman's home) in the town.  There he sells his creations during the months of February, June and October.  These are the months when there are many tourists in the area.

This successful man has also been making fireworks for 3 years.  As his financial situation has improved considerably, he would like to invest in the future in opening a gift store.  This is his first loan with MFP and, as a new member of his community bank, he is sure that he will be very successful and achieve a lot.  He will use his loan to stock his store with gifts such as disposable plates, glassware and earthenware products which he plans to sell over the Christmas period.

loans.use: Disposable plates, cups, glassware and earthenware products to stock his store

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a resident of a small city named Riwind in Pakistan. Riwind city is famous for its dairy industry. She lives with her family in a two-room house. Kosar is 38 years old, a talented lady, and performs her duty of a seamstress. In order to financially support her family she sews clothes for her neighborhood. She is very good at her work and can sew every designer's clothes, and due to her good work her customers give her regular orders. Her husband’s name is M. A., and he operates a brick-selling business. He purchases bricks from the brickmakers and provides them to his clients for a profit. 

Kosar has given birth to 2 sons and 3 daughters. Her eldest son could not get an education due to the poor financial conditions of his family. He is a tailor by profession and operates a tailoring shop in the market. He learned this art from his mother and now is becoming an expert in his work. 

Kosar has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy bricks in bulk quantity that will cut his cost of purchasing and also enable him fulfilling larger orders on time. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Kosar.

loans.use: To buy bricks for bricks selling business

loans.name: C2379 Izere Group

texts.en:
The Izere Group is made up of six members. Their leader is Claudine. This is the Izere Group's first loan from Vision Finance Company. They will use it to purchase more products for their market stalls.

Claudine is the leader of the group. She is 28 years old and married. She has 5 children between the ages of 1 and 9. Claudine owns a market store in the Rwamagana District of Rwanda. The store is open from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day. Claudine has three years of experience in this business. She has two employees and her store is well-organized, packed with things, and known in her area. 

With this Izere Group loan, Claudine will purchase more food products. With the profits from her business Claudine hopes to pay for school fees, renovate her house, and provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more food for her food stall

loans.name: Nelda

texts.es: Nelda, de 39 años, convive con Julian, de 40 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores: Tatiana, de 20, Sherly de 18 y Kevin de 16 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Está carismática mujer cuenta que desde niña, su madre le enseñó a tejer y desde entonces se divierte mucho elaborando diversas prendas de vestir. “De eso hace 20 años, nunca pensé que ganaría dinero divirtiéndome”, menciona. Durante la semana Nelda, viaja a las ciudades de Cerro de Paco, Oroya y Junín, donde vende sus tejidos a buen precio. Ahora ella tienen planeado abrir una galería en la ciudad turística de Huancayo, ahí los tejidos de chompas, chalecos y gorras; principales tejidos de Nelda, tienen mayor demanda y pagan buen precio por ello. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo de trabajo arduo en su banco comunal; pudo encontrar apoyo en la realización de sus objetivos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, le ayudará en la compra de materiales como: Lana de diversos colores, y si el dinero le alcanza podrá comprar mercadería para poder venderlo en su próximo viaje.
texts.en: Nelda, age 39, has a common law marriage with Julian, who is 40 years old. They have 3 younger children together: Tatiana, 20, Sherly 18, and Kevin, 16. Together as a family, they live in their own house, located in the region of San Pedro de Cajas. This charismatic woman, says that since she was a child, her mother has taught her how to knit. Since then, she has really enjoyed making clothing garments. "20 years ago, I never thought that I would make money while enjoying myself," she says. During the week, Nelda travels to the cities of Cerro de Paco, Oroya, and Junín, where she sells her garments at a good price. Now she has planned to open a gallery in the tourist city of Huancayo, where she will have garments such as sweaters, vests, and hats. Nelda's main garments have a high demand and people pay a good price for them. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and in all this time of hard work in her communal bank, she hasn't been able to find support in the realization of her objectives. The loan that she will obtain will help her to buy materials such as different colored wool, and if the money allows, she will be able to buy merchandise to sell on her upcoming journey.

loans.use: To buy multicolored wool.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a thirty-eight-year-old married man who is blessed with five children. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He aspires to have an educated family and become a model household in the village. He sells firewood for a living. He has been in the field for three years and it has enabled him to pay school fees for his children. His passion is to have a store that supplies a bigger area. Thomas needs the loan to purchase firewood to sell.

loans.use: To buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.es: La Sra. Escolástica Vive en el municipio D. el Torno,  es nacida en el departamento D. Potosí, hace unos 15 años que se vino al departamento buscando mejores oportunidades, su actividad es la venta D. productos naturales destinado a la medicina, hace unos dos años que se dedica a esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para la construcción D. su casa, ya que esta en obra rustica y necesita comprar material D. construccion,  su es poso con el cual tiene 4 hijos, se dedica a la  venta D. madera, y muy pronto estará dedicándose a la misma actividad que su esposa, y a que vieron que se obtiene buenas ganancias, la Sra. Es muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Escolástica lives in the town of Torno.  She was born in the department of Potosí, and fifteen years ago she came to this department looking for better opportunities.  She sells natural products for use in medicines, which she's been doing for about two years.  She plans to use her loan to buy building building materials that she needs for her rustic house.  Her husband, with whom she has four children, is a wood vendor, and soon he'll be in the same business as Escolástica because she brings in a good profit. She is very hard-working and she appreciates Emprender for its support.

loans.use: To finish building her house.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María, resiD. en Yoloaiquin, departamento D. Morazán, es comerciante D. cosméticos, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos: Iris D. 16, Roberto D. 13, Yolanda D. 3 años D. edad, él es empleado D. la fuerza armada, y ella pues su negocio lo realiza a través D. revistas, visita a todos los vecinos y lugares cercanos casa por casa ofreciendo los productos.
En esta temporada que se acercan  las fiestas D. fin D. año quiere comprar productos que están en ofertas para vendarlas a precio normal, dándole una ganancia extra, por eso solicita un préstamo para comprar esta mercadería a bajo costo.
Sus aspiraciones son apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios, para que estos tengan un mejor futuro y mejores condiciones para su vida.
texts.en: Maria sells cosmetics and lives with her husband and three children (Iris age 16, Roberto 13, and Yolanda 3) in Yoloaiquin in the department of Morazan. Her husband works for the armed forces and she visits her neighbors nearby selling goods through catalogs. As the year end festivities draw near she wants to buy products that are discounted to sell them at regular price thus earning extra profit. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy this merchandise and a lower cost. She hopes to support her children in their studies so that they can have a better future and a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Maritza Del Socorro tiene 47 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, el propósito es apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Es una persona muy responsable siempre le ha gustado trabajar todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano ya que tiene que salir a vender sus productos de manera ambulante pues también en su domicilio ofrece ciertos productos. Sus clientes en su mayoría son personas que viven cerca de su vivienda, familiares, vecinos y amigos. Este crédito es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, ropa, calzado y cosméticos por lo que se acerca un buena temporada y quiere aprovechar para ofrecer de todo.
texts.en: Maritza Del Socorro, 47, sells general merchandise.  She has had this business for more than 20 years, and its purpose is to help with the household expenses.  She is a very responsible person who has always enjoyed working.  She gets up early every day, since she has to sell her products door-to-door, and she also offers certain products for sale from her home.  Most of her customers are people who live close to her home: relatives, neighbors and friends.  This loan is to buy towels, bed sheets, clothing, shoes and cosmetics, because the good sales season is approaching and she wants to take advantage of it by having a lot of goods to sell.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.fr: Elle est mariée et a 28 ans. Pour participer au ménage, elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits d’alimentations générale et cumule dans cette tâche près de 3 ans déjà.  Elle achète souvent au grand marché de Lomé et expose ses différents produits à la devanture de sa maison. Le crédit sollicité permettra d’acheter de nouveaux lots de produits et satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: She is married and 28 years old. To help with family expenses, she sells general food products, a business in which she already has almost three years of experience. She often buys her goods at the big market of Lomé and exhibits them for sale in front of her home. The loan she is seeking will allow her to purchase new lots of food products and serve more customers.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: Justo, de 52 años, convive con Domitila, de 46 años. Ambos tuvieron 2 hijos: Roxana, de 21 y Viviana, de 17 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquila, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Este hombre hábil y emprendedor; trabajaba en una tienda de venta de combustibles, labor que le generaba un dinero extra a su oficio de artesano que desde los 18 años hasta hoy practica. Hoy posee su propio taller, siendo sus principales tejidos: ponchos y mantas; los que gracias a su dedicación y creatividad, le generan grandes pedidos de compradores de las diferentes ciudades del país, los que constantemente visitan su taller, para poder comprarlos. Sus buenas ganancias, le permitieron ahorrar y hace tan solo tres años, abrió su propio “grifo”, ahí suministra gasolina a los diferentes chóferes de su localidad. Ahora desea invertir más en la mejora de su negocio. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y se siente feliz del trabajo realizado en todo este tiempo, “ya aprendí a ahorrar y proyectarme”, afirma. Con el crédito que obtendrá, le ayudará a invertir en la compra de combustibles, donde cada cilindro cuesta un promedio de S/. 620.00 nuevos soles y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá también en la compra de hilos y demás insumos para la elaboración de sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Justo is 52 and lives with Domitila age 46. They have two children: Roxana age 21 and Viviana, 17. They all live is a rented home in San Pedro de Cajas. He is a skilled and hardworking man who used to work is a gas sales business which generated additional income to his work as an artisan which he has done since he was 18. 

Today he has his own workshop making mainly ponchos and blankets. Thanks to his dedication and creativity he has large orders from customers in different cities around the country. They visit his shop frequently to purchase his goods. His profits allowed him to save up and open his own small gas station where he sells to drivers in his area. 

Now he wants to invest in improving his business. This is his third loan with MFP and he is happy with his accomplishments thus far, saying "I learned how to save and grow." With this loan he will invest in buying fuel with each gas canister costing an average of S./620.00 Nuevos Soles. If he has enough left then he will buy thread and other items for his knitting business

loans.use: Purchase gas ciliner and thread for knitting.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida lives in Riwind, which is a small city of Pakistan and famous for its dairy industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area named Riwind markaz. 

Her husband's name is A. R., and he is a tailor by profession. His shop is in the market and sews specifically men’s clothes there. Due to his quality of work and good behavior with customers, he receives regular orders every month. 

Zubaida has given birth to 5 children: 2 daughters and 3 sons. Her eldest son is illiterate and works in a hotel for a low income. Other children are enrolled in a school and are getting their education. 

Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his business. With the loan, he will buy another sewing machine and hire a worker that will help him fulfill orders on time and do the job more effectively. 

Zubaida is hopeful that after a loan investment, her husband will bring more profits from his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Zubaida.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Daniel Cristian
