El señora Yely de edad de 31 años vive en la zona de la Guardia hace  12 años   la señora  oriunda  de Mairana Florida se vino a santa cruz para encontrar días mejores para su familia,                                                                                                      Su actividad es la venta de comida hace 2 años en la zona, como segunda actividad cuenta con la venta de cosmético de vez en cuando.
Estado civil: viuda hace 3 meses fue un golpe duro para ella pero salió adelante por  sus dos hijas  que actualmente están estudiando  en el nivel primario, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su puesto de venta ya que tiene mas clientela que viene a degustar sus riquísimos platillos, es un apersona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Señora Yely is 31 years old. She has lived in the La Guardia zone for 12 years. She is originally from Mairana Florida, and she came to Santa Cruz to find better times for her family.

For two years, she has had a business selling food in this area. As a second business, she sometimes sells cosmetics.

She has been a widow for 3 months. This was a hard blow for her, but she has moved forward for her two daughters, who are in primary school.

She will use the money from the loan to buy tables and chairs to expand her food stall, since she has more customers who come to enjoy her delicious dishes. She is a very hard-working person and is grateful to this institution for the support that they offer.

loans.use: Increase her working capital and buy plastic chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will buy materials to be used to prepare hot dogs and hamburgers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Sra. Mariana es una persona muy alegre y dinámica. Ella vive en la zona D. Villa Salome que se encuentra a cuarenta minutos del centro D. la cuidad.  Mariana se dedica a la venta D. comida y su especialidad son los silpanchos con huevos y los asados. VenD. la comida solo por la noche pero uno D. sus anhelos es ampliar su negocio para vender almuerzos en el día. Ella tiene cuatro hijos D. los cuales los tres primeros ya son personas mayores y profesionales, solo vive con su pequeña hija la cual esta en edad escolar. Su esposo esta D. viaje por motivos D. trabajo y por eso mariana tiene el trabajo D. llevar adelante su hogar. Ella es una persona respetuosa y muy responsable, con el dinero del crédito comprara abarrotes como arroz, fideo, papa, aceite para la elaboración D. riquísimos platillos, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Mrs. Mariana is a happy and dynamic person. She lives in the Villa Salome zone, which is located forty minutes from the center of the city. Mariana sells food and her specialty is “silpanchos” with eggs or grilled meat. She sells the meals only at night. One of her desires is to grow her business in order to sell lunch during the day. She has four children. The older three children are grown and have professions. She only lives with her youngest child who is still in school. Her husband travels to find work and because of this Mariana has to work to support their house. Mariana is a respectful and responsible person. With this money she will buy groceries such as rice, noodles, potatoes, and oil in order to make her delicious dishes. She is very thankful for the institution that provides this assistance.

loans.use: She will buy rice, potatoes and noodles.

loans.name: María Clara

texts.es:
La Señora María Z. es socia del banco comunal San José, vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que  pertenecr a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se encuentra a 18 km. de la ciudad de Cuenca, su principal actividad economía es la agricultura y cría de animales que en su mayoría es para su propio abastecimiento, tiene como atractivo turístico el cerro Mama Tepal el cual es un mirador natural y se puede observar la ciudad de Cuenca y parte de la ciudad de Azogues.

La Señora. María tiene 43 años y está separada hace 4 años de su esposo, tiene 5 hijos  de 21, 20, 17, 13 y 11 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian y trabajan ayudando en la economía del hogar, su cuarto hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija  en una escuela del sector, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa prestada que es de su padre.

Doña María hace 3 años se dedica a laborar como empleada domestica, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, en su casa se dedica a la cría de animales los que son para su consumo y también los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace dos años y medio, su cuñada le ha invitado para que forme parte de este gran grupo de mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y también en víveres para su hogar. Su meta es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Señora María Z. is a member of the San José communal bank. She lives in the community of Ingapirca, which belongs to the parish of Santa Ana. This parish is located some 18km from the city of Cuenca, and boasts the Mama Tepal hill, which is a beautiful natural viewpoint from where tourists can see the city of Cuenca and part of the city of Azogues. Señora Maria's main economic activity is agriculture and raising animals, with most of the produce used to sustain her family. 

Señora María, age 43, has been separated from her husband these past 4 years, and has 5 children, aged 21, 20, 17, 13, and 11. Her 3 heldest children are studying and working, and helping with the costs of the household. Her fourth, a son, is studying at secondary school, and her youngest daughter is at school nearby. They don't own their own home, but live in a house belongning to her father.

For the past 3 years, Señora María has been employed as a domestic servant, working Monday to Friday from 9 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. At home she raises animals. Although they are mostly for the family's own consumption, she also sells them when they need the money. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 and a half years. Her sister in law invited her to join and be part of this large group of hard-working, determined women. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs and staple foods for her household. Her goal is to set up a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: To buy guinea-pigs and staple foods.

loans.name: Wilfrido Antonio

texts.es: Wilfrido M. es un hombre viudo, padre de 5 hijos en las edades de 12 a 19 años, que asumió él solo el negocio “Reciclaje Ronaldiño”, después de su muerte su esposa. Desde hace 7 años había iniciado esta tarea acompañándola, pues era ella quien estaba vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, labor que él continuó con el propósito de hacer crecer su negocio con esta organización, para ofrecerles un mejor bienestar a sus hijos. A lo largo de sus 7 años Reciclaje Ronaldiño ha crecido y es la fuente principal de sus ingresos en el hogar. Con los financiamientos ha logrado invertir en la compra de productos reciclables de contado como vidrio, papel, hierro, cartón y plástico, pero últimamente ha dirigido su énfasis hacia el cobre, pues le da una rentabilidad es de un 70%. Por eso con su credikiva comprará este metal que venderá a empresas transformadoras del mismo, que fabrican tubería, rejas, adornos y que últimamente venden a la China. Wilfrido compra al menudeo a s recicladores individuales que lo recogen y llevan a sus manos; el cuenta con basculas y pesos para desempeñar esta labor. La rotación de sus compras es diaria y de sus inventarios es dos veces por semana por lo que se siente satisfecho con su negocio, pero aspira a lograr aumentar sus ganancias permanentemente, y esto es mediante la inversión, por eso está vinculado a la Fundación para tener un capital en efectivo con el que comprar en volumen, porque sus sueños y gran desafío es sacar solo a sus hijos adelante por el gran vacio que dejó la ausencia de su esposa y madre de estos jóvenes
texts.en:
Wilfrido M. is a widower.  He is the father of 5 children aged between 12 and 19.  He took on the business 'Reciclaje Ronaldiño' (Ronaldiño Recycling) alone after his wife died.  He had started this task, together with his wife, 7 years ago as it was his wife who had links to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo but he has continued the work with the intention of making the business grow with this organization so that he can offer his children a better well-being.

Throughout its 7 years, 'Reciclaje Ronaldiño' has grown and it is the main source of income for Wilfrido's household.  With the help of loans, he has managed to invest in the purchase of recyclable products such as glass, paper, iron, cardboard and plastics.  However, lately he has been directing his focus more towards copper since it provides 70% profits.  For this reason, he will use his Kiva loan to buy this metal which he will sell to companies who transform it to make pipes, bars, decorations and ultimately sell it to China.

Wilfrido buys retail from individual recyclers who collect the material and bring it to him.  He has scales and weights to carry out this task.  The rotation of his purchases is daily and the rotation of his whole inventory is twice a week.  He feels satisfied with his business but he aspires to increase his sales permanently through investment.  This is why he is with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so that he can have capital in cash with which he can buy in volume because his dream and his greatest challenge is to get his children ahead in life on his own faced with the enormous hole that the absence of his wife and the kids' mother has left.

loans.use: To buy copper which he will sell to be transformed

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines tiene 55 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio como una alternativa de vida para ella y su familia con el paso del tiempo Maria logro observar que era un negocio muy rentable y este era el único medio de ingreso que obtenía para su familia. Ella tiene la meta de seguir trabajando con este negocio y agrandar su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de sabanas, toallas, ropa en general, cosmético y calzado.
texts.en: Maria Ines is 55 years old. Her business is selling clothes and household goods, which she has been doing for more than 7 years. It started as an alternative way of meeting living costs for herself and her family, but with the passage of time Maria has made it a success. She says that the business became very profitable until it became the sole means of income for her family. Her aim is to keep working and expand her business. The loan will be used to buy sheets, towels, clothing, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer - Cusco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO"; la socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Kris Milagros, La socia tiene 29 años de edad ella es soltera y tiene 1 hijo;  la socia se dedica a administrar una agencia de viajes y turismo, la agencia de la socia está ubicada en la ciudad del Cusco; la socia desea poner en su casa en el primer piso junto a sus parientes un depósito de cerveza, para lo cual está solicitando el préstamo, ella y su familia atenderán en turnos que se les haga posible la administración y la atención de este su nuevo negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en un depósito de cervezas que la socia pondrá en su casa.

Los otros socios se dedican a comercio minorista, ellos se dedican a la administración de su restaurante, bar karaoke, a la atención de una ferretería, y otros dos socios se dedican a la atención en el area de promotores en espectaculos.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahincó para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Kris Milagros is a member of the "NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO" ("New Dawn - Cusco") community bank.  She lives in Huanchac district in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Kris Milagros is 29 years old, single, and has one son.  She runs a travel agency, which is located in the city of Cusco.  She and her relatives want to open a beer shop on the first floor of their house, which is why she is requesting this loan. She and her family will take it in turns to run this new business. She will use the requested loan to install the beer shop in her home.  

The other members of the bank are small traders.  They run a restaurant, a karaoke bar, and a hardware store, while two  group members work promoting live shows.

Kris is grateful for this loan and promises to keep working hard so she can meet her payments and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of beer to sell from her home.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 24 años, convive con Nilton, de 30 años. Producto de su amor, nació Luis, de 4 años de edad. En unión familiar, los tres viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la comunidad Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Cuando era niña, su papá tenia una cajonería (fábrica de cajas de madera que se utiliza para envasar frutas), en ahí aprendió este oficio y desde entonces hasta hoy, se dedica a ello, pero no trabaja para su padre, los constantes problemas de enfermedad que sufría le impidieron surgir y, tubo que cerrar. Ahora Jessica trabaja, para terceros, donde todas las mañanas realiza un promedio de 300 cajones diarios, los cuales después se comercializa a diferentes partes del país. Pero lo que más le gusta a Jessica, es dedicarse íntegramente en sus sombríos de café y plátanos. Ya tienen 2 años dedicándose a ello y se siente feliz y realizada, ya que es “su propio negocio”, afirma. Lo que le molesta a ella es la lejanía de su terreno agrícola, donde tiene que caminar muchas horas para poder llegar, pero consiente de sus buenos ingresos ella está ahorrando para comprar su casa propia. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y, como integrante nueva de su banco comunal; se siente satisfecha de los logros alcanzados en esté corto tiempo y, espera que más adelante pueda lograr todos sus objetivos. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 200 mamones de isla (plantas de plátano), que oscila entre un nuevo sol por unidad. Con ello podrá renovar su producción de plátano.
texts.en: Jessica, 24, lives with Nilton, 30. The product of their love, Luis, was born, and is 4 years old. In family union, the three live in a rented home, located in the community of Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian rainforest). When she was a child, her father had a "cajonería" (a factory making wooden crates used for packing fruit), in there she learnt this trade and from then right up to today, she has done this, but she doesn't work for her father, the constant health problems that he suffered prevented this from arising, and he had to shut. Now Jessica works for third parties, where every morning she makes an average of 300 crates daily, which are sold in different parts of the country. But what Jessica likes the most, is to immerse herself entirely her plantings of coffee and plantain trees. She has been doing this for 2 years and she feels happy and fulfilled, since this is “her own business”, she states. What bothers her is the remoteness of her farming land, as she has to walk for many hours to get there, but it gives her a good income and she is saving to buy her own home. This is the second loan with MFP and, as a new member of her communal bank; she is satisfied with the successes achieved in this short time and, she hopes that in the future she can achieve all her goals. On receiving the requested loan she is planning to buy 200 "mamones de isla" (plantain plants), which are about one nuevo sol per unit. With it she can renew her plantain production.

loans.use: To purchase 200 plantain plants.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 44 años de edad, convive con Edgardo, de 50 años. Ambos tuvieron 3 hijos: Joel, de 20, Wilder, de 18 y Gisela de 16 años. Todos en unión familiar, viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). La dedicación que le brida a su trabajo, es muy importante para Felicita, pues gracias al tiempo que pasa en sus cultivos, puede tener una buena cosecha en cada campaña agrícola. Ya tiene 15 años consagrándose en el noble oficio de la agricultura, en todo esté tiempo adquirió muchos conocimientos y se siente feliz por ello. Sus principales cultivos constan de café y plátano; los cuales los vende en su misma localidad, donde después de cada cosecha encajona y vende a los comerciantes mayoristas que llegan los días martes y jueves. Felicita, se siente muy satisfecha por los resultados que está obteniendo; por ello más adelante desea incursionar en el sembrío de más productos, como: Palta y cítricos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y agradece todo este tiempo. Pues asegura, que gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, pudo salir adelante. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar, 10 sacos de abono, cuyo valor por unidad oscila entre los noventa soles. Con ello, podrá mantener su producción de café, con una buena calidad.
texts.en:
Felicita, who is 44 years old, lives with Edgardo, who is 50 years old. They have three children together: Joel, who is 20, Wilder, who is 18, and Gisela, who is 16. The family all lives together in their own home in the Puente Paucartambo community (central region of the peruvian rainforest). The dedication she brings to her work is the most important for Felicita, since thanks to the time she spends with her crops, she can have a better harvest in each field. She has been working in the noble field of agriculture for 15 years now. In all this time, she has accumulated much knowledge and she is happy for it. Her principal crops are coffee and plantains, which she sells in the same place, where after each harvest she boxes up and sells to the wholesale customers who come on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

Felicita is very pleased with the results she has obtained. Because of it, she wants to tackle planting more products like avocados and citrus fruits. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very grateful. She says that thanks to the support of her community bank, she was able to advance. She plans to use the funds from the loan to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer, the value of which oscillates around 90 soles. With this fertilizer, she can maintain her coffee production levels, keeping high quality.

loans.use: Purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Z. es socia del banco comunal San José, vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se encuentra a 18 km. de la ciudad de Cuenca, su principal actividad económica es la agricultura y cría de animales que en su mayoría es para su propio abastecimiento, tiene como atractivo turístico el cerro Mama Tepal el cual es un mirador natural y se puede observar la ciudad de Cuenca y parte de la ciudad de Azogues.

Doña Rosa tiene de 36 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 18, 15, 13, 10, 7 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja como empleada domestica y ayuda en la economía del hogar, también estudia  corte y confección, su segundo hijo trabaja y ayuda económicamente en casa y también estudia en un colegio a distancia, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela del sector, su esposo labora en la área de la construcción siendo maestro albañil, con el trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Rosa hace apenas seis meses está trabajando como empleada domestica, labora de 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde y solo dos días a la semana, el resto de su tiempo se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y como pasa en casa aprovecha para dedicarse a la cría de pollos y cuyes, los que son para la venta y también para su consumo.

Es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos para criar. Su meta es  comprarse una vaca lechera.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Z. is a member of the San José communal bank. She lives in the community of Ingapirca, which belongs to the parish of Santa Ana. This parish is located some 18km from the city of Cuenca, and boasts the Mama Tepal hill, which is a beautiful natural viewpoint from where tourists can see the city of Cuenca and part of the city of Azogues. Señora Rosa's main economic activity is agriculture and raising animals, with most of the produce used to sustain her family.

Señora Rosa, age 36, is married and has 5 children, aged 18, 15, 13, 10, and 7 years old. Her eldest daughter is employed as a domestic servant, and helps out with the household expenses; she is also studying dressmaking. Her second child, a son, also works and helps with expenses, and is also studying at secondary school some distance away. Her two younger sons attend a local school, and her husband works in construction, being a master builder. Alongside his work, he has also succeeded in building their own house. 

Señora Rosa has been emloyed as a domestic servant for the past 6 months. She works from 8am until 4pm, just 2 days a week. The rest of her time she dedicates to looking after her children. She makes the most of the time she spends at home by raising chickens and guinea-pigs, both for sale and for the family's own consumption.

This is her second loan through the communal bank. She was invited to join by a friend. this new loan will be invested in the purchase of more chickens to raise. Her goal is to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Gladys Teresa

texts.es:
Gladys de 36 años, vende habas (frijoles conocidos por sus propiedades alimentarias medicinales). Vive en una casa de caña con su esposo y tres hijos en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.

Hace 6 años para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos empezó a vender habas. Ella comprar las habas con su cascara pero para poderlas vender el procedimiento que hace es sacarlos de la cascara ponerlos a remojar y limpiarlo para ubicarlos en unas pequeñas fundas y venderlos. Su esposo es albañil pero después que termina su trabajo vende en un mercado llamado “Montebello” las habas. 

Con el préstamo quieren comprar hablas para poder procesarlas y venderlas y otra parte del préstamo dirigirla a la casa ya que ahora es de caña comprando, cemento. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Gladys is 36 years old. She sells fava beans ( beans known for their medicinal and culinary properties). She lives in a cane house with her husband and three children on the outskirts of Guayaquil. They live in an area called Paraíso de la flor characterized for its dirt roads and mountains.

Six years ago, in order to help her husband with the household expenses and to give her children a better life, Gladys started selling fava beans. She buys the beans in their shells. To prepare them for selling she follows a certain procedure. She takes them out of their shells to soak and clean them. She puts them in small containers and sells them. Her husband is a construction worker but after work, he sells the fava beans in the “Montebello” market.

With this loan, they want to buy fava beans to process and sell. The other part of the loan will go to their cane house, to buy cement. In the future, Gladys wants to have a well established business.

loans.use: to buy fava beans and cement

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 49 años, está casada, con Ervin, de 54 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos: Lisbet, de 4 años, a la que educan y cría en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Hace tan solo dos años, que Norma sufrió la pérdida de su casa; producto de un Huaico (crecida del río, que contiene lodo y agua abundante), que gracias a la labor humanitaria de los miembros de su banco comunal, pudo salir adelante. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de gaseosa y cerveza en un pequeño negocio que acondicionó en su casa. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Norma; ya que gracias a su buena sazón en la cocina, los profesores de la única escuela de su localidad, la contratan para que les prepare los alimentos del día, pues la mayoría son de otra ciudad y viven en casas alquiladas. A ella, le va muy bien en su negocio y más adelante está pensando ampliar su negocio no solo con bebidas, también abrir un restaurante, donde venda las ricas comidas que sabe preparar. Esté es el octavo crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo de apoyo solidario, brindado por su banco comunal; se siente muy feliz de haber logrado sus objetivos. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar, varias mesas y sillas, como también insumos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is 49 years old, and is married to Ervin who is 54 years old. They have three children, but only one of their children lives with them: Lisbet, who is 4 years old, and who they educate and raise in their own home in the Puente Paucartambo community (in the central peruvian rainforest). Only two years ago, Norma lost her house due to a Huaico (rising of the river which contained mud and too much water). Thanks to the humanitarian labor of members of her community bank, she was able to move forward.

She sells soft drinks and beer in a small business within her home. Norma does not just do this, but also, thanks to her skill in the kitchen, the teachers at the only school in her area contract her to prepare daily meals since the majority of them are from another city and live in rented houses. To her, this business is very good, and going forward, she is hoping to grow her business to not only sell drinks but also to open a restaurant, where she can sell the rich foods she knows how to prepare.

This is her eighth loan with MFP, and all this time of receiving support from her community bank, she has felt very happy to have had achieved her goals. In acquiring this loan, she hopes to purchase various tables and chairs as well as other supplies for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of tables, chairs, and products for food preparation

loans.name: Tania Maricela

texts.es:
La Señora. Tania V. es socia del banco comunal San José, vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se encuentra a 18 km. de la ciudad de Cuenca, su principal actividad económica es la agricultura y cría de animales que en su mayoría es para su propio abastecimiento, tiene como atractivo turístico el cerro Mama Tepal el cual es un mirador natural y se puede observar la ciudad de Cuenca y parte de la ciudad de Azogues.

La Señora. Tania es una socia muy joven de la banca comunal, tiene 20 años, es casada y tiene una hija de un año y seis meses de edad, su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven por el momento en casa de sus suegros.
 
Doña Tania labora en un Centro de Formación Infantil, actividad que desempeña hace un año y siete meses, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de unos cerdos para iniciar con este negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Tania V. is a member of the San José communal bank. She lives in Ingapirca, in the Santa Ana parish. This parish is located 18km. from the city of Cuenca. The basic economic activities there are farming and raising animals which are mainly used for personal supplies. There is a tourist attraction called the Mama Tepal hill. The hill is a natural viewpoint and you can see the city of Cuenca and part of the city of Azogues from there.

Tania is a very young member of the communal bank. She is 20 years old. She is married and she has a one and half year old daughter. Her husband works as a construction worker. They do not have their own home. For now, they live with the in-laws.

Tania works in a preschool center. She has held this position for a year and a half. She works Monday to Friday, from eight in the morning until four in the afternoon.

This is her third loan with the communal bank. Her new loan will be used to invest in the purchase of some pigs to start a business. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly, de 33 años, convive con Roberto de 40 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Roberto de 14, Medaly de 12 y Milagros de 8 años. En unión familiar, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en L. localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Está mujer trabajadora, se dedica a muchas actividades, pues es muy activa, hace 15 años que viene dedicándose a L. agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de café, plátano y palta. Los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa a su vecina Nadia, que es una comerciante mayorista de frutas, que distribuye a diferentes lugares del país. Ya en las tardes se dedica a L. venta de comida, ya que conocedores de su buena sazón; los profesores de L. localidad L. contrataron para su alimentación diaria. En sus diferentes negocios elL. se siente desarrollada, y para el futuro tiene muchos planes, uno de ellos es acondicionar su casa para alquilar cuartos, y ya comenzó con el alquiler de una habitación. De L. misma manera desea poner una pequeña panadería en su localidad, comprando un horno artesanal, como primer paso. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y, en todo el tiempo que está trabajando en su banco comunal se siente satisfecha por el apoyo mutuo que se brindan unas a otras; logrando así su desarrollo. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 500 mamones (plantas de plátano) para renovar sus plantaciones sus platanales y, si el dinero le alcanza podrá adquirir 3 sacos de abono que osciL. entre 120 nuevos soles cada uno.
texts.en:
Magaly is 33 years old and lives with her partner, Roberto, who is 40 years old. They have three children: Roberto (14), Medaly (12) and Milagros (8). They live in their own house located in Puente Paucartambo (central Peruvian jungle).

She is a hardworking woman and works in many activities, as she is very active. She has been working in agriculture for the past 15 years and her main crops consist of coffee, bananas and avocado. After each harvest, she sells them to her neighbor, Nadia, who is a wholesale fruit merchant and distributes them to different places in the country. In the afternoons, Magaly works selling food and since they are familiar with her good seasoning, the professors in her area hired her to make their daily food. She feels developed in her different businesses and has many plans for the future, one of which is to set up her house to rent rooms. She already started with the rental of one bedroom. Similarly, she wants to set up a small bakery in her area, purchasing an artisanal oven as a first step.

This is her fifth loan with MFP and throughout all of the time that she has been working with her communal bank, she feels satisfied with the mutual support that they provide to one another, thus achieving their development. With the loan acquired, she plans to purchase 500 ‘mamones’ (banana plants) to revitalize her banana plantations and, if there is enough money, she will also be able to get three sacks of manure that tend to be around 120 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) each.

loans.use: To purchase 500 banana plants and 3 sacks of manure

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 27 años, está casada con Rudy, de 28 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jack, de 9 y Anahi, de 3 años. Los tres como una gran familia, viven en su casa de su mamá, ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Las labores de Margarita son múltiples, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a la “cajonería” (lugar donde se hacen cajones de madera, que se utilizan para vender frutas), en todo este tiempo pudo juntar un capital de dinero necesario para poder abrir un restaurante de anticuchos, los que en todo este tiempo, tiene gran acogida. Como mujer joven y trabajadora Margarita, tuvo una buena idea y ahora no solo vende anticuchos, también hamburguesas y pollo crocante. Pero, las ganas de luchar de está mujer son increíbles, ya que hace tan solo 2 años que incursionó en la agricultura, donde siembra plátano y café. Ahora ella quiere comprar terrenos agrícolas, pero sin descuidarse de su negocio. Para ello ella tiene pensado comprar una casa propia, donde pueda decorar su restaurante de manera más llamativa. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y, se siente feliz de regresar a su banco comunal, donde siente que cada día progresa más. De adquirir el dinero solicitado tiene pensado comprar bebidas y dulces, para surtir su restaurante de anticuchos (comida a base de corazón de pollo), como también si el dinero le alcanza, comprará un parrillero de fierro, para poder cocinar sus ricos platos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 27 years old, and is married to Rudy, who is 28 years old. They have two children: Jack, 9, and Anahi, 3. Like a big family, they all live in her mom's house in the Puente Paucartambo community, which is in the central region of the peruvian rainforest. For 10 years, Margarita has worked making wooden boxes in which fruit is sold. In this time, she has been able to collect enough money to open a kebab restaurant which was very well received. As a young and hardworking women, Margarita had a great idea and now not only sells kebabs but also hamburgers and crispy chicken.

Her drive is incredible and only two years ago, she invested in agriculture, where she plants plantains and coffee. Now she wants to buy more farmland, but without neglecting her business. To do this, she wants to buy her own home, where she can decorate her restaurant in a more striking way.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is happy to return to her community bank, where she feels that every day she progresses more. She plans to use this loan to purchase sweets and drinks and to supply her kebab restaurant and if she has funds leftover, she will buy a grill so she can cook her rich dishes.

loans.use: Purchase drinks, sweets, and a grill for her restaurant

loans.name: Jovanna Germania

texts.es:
Jovanna vende pollos listos para cocinar. Vive con sus dos hijas de 15 y 12 años en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Hace 9 meses el papa de sus dos hijos la abandono y ella tuvo que encargarse de los gastos de la casa. Por eso decidió invertir sus ahorros en pollos para venderlos a un valor donde ella pueda ganar dinero. Los comprar en una avícola muy económicos y los vende a sus vecinos y conocidos del sector. No tiene local aun por eso utiliza la puerta de su casa para despachar los pollos que les piden. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, zinc para arreglar su casa que no esta bien construida. En el futuro quiere tener arreglada su casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jovanna sells chickens ready to cook. She lives with her two daughters, 15 and 12 years old, in a periurban area with all of the basic utilities. It is located in the Perimetral de Guayaquil, an area surrounded by a marsh.

Nine months ago, the father of her daughters abandoned her and she had to take responsibility of the household expenses. This is why she decided to invest her savings in chickens to sell them at a price where she can earn money. She buys them very economically at a poultry farm and sells them to her neighbors and acquaintances in the area. She still does not have a place for her business, which is why she uses the door of her house to deal with the chickens that they request.

With the loan, she wants to purchase cement and zinc to fix her house because it is not well-built. In the future she wants to have her house fixed for her children.

loans.use: Cement, zinc

loans.name: Jesus Joaquin

texts.es: El  Sr. Jesus Joaquin G., es una persona muy emprendedora, que le gusta mucho el comercio, el  ya obruvo un credito con esta institucion, y le parecio que  lo ayudo mucho en lo que el necesitaba invertir, por eso recurre nuevamente a esta institucion, por que este año el se quiere preparar con mas mercancia de electronica, ya que su clientela ha ido en aumento y le solicitan mas reparaciones de aparatos, asi como accesorios que el tambien vende a un precio muy  accsesible, poco a poco ha ido agrandando el negocio, que es el sustento de su familia, ya que de el dependen su esposa y sus 3 hijos a los que mantiene desde  alimentacion, casa y vestido. y  esta muy satisfecho con  el credito que esta institucion le ha brindado.
texts.en: Jesus Joaquin G. is a very enterprising person who likes being in business a lot.  He has already had a loan from this insitutions and it would appear that it helped him a lot with what he needed to invest in.  For this reason, he is turning to the institution again because this year he wants to be prepared with more electronics merchandise since his customer base has grown and his customers are asking him to repair more appliances as well as asking him for accessories which he also sells at very affordable prices.  Little by little, he has managed to expand his business which is his family's source of support since his wife and 3 children depend on it and he relies on it to feed them, house them and dress them.  He is very satisfied with the loan that this institution has offered him.

loans.use: To invest in his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aura Olaya

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Libertad #1.
 
Desde hace ya 8 años la señora Aura es socia del Banco Comunal Libertad # 1 y está muy contenta ya que gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de parte de la Fundación Espoir ha podido sacar a su familia adelante. Ella tiene 78 años de edad, es viuda y de esa relación tuvo 4 hijos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven aun con ella, uno de sus hijos está enfermo.
 
Ella además de haber sido una gran madre y ama de casa se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene un puesto de comida en el mercado de Portoviejo, prepara deliciosos platos, entre los que los clientes siempre le piden esta el caldo de pata, la guatita, el caldo y seco de gallina entre otros platos que ella con mucho amor prepara, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 23h00, su hija le ayuda en su negocio. Dice que ya tiene su local por muchos años y que siempre le ha ido bien ya que los clientes la prefieren por su sazón.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar arroz, gallinas, gaseosas, y otros productos e ingredientes para preparar sus ricos platos. Sus sueños son que su hijo se cure y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Libertad #1 communal bank meet every two weeks.

Aura has been a member of the Libertad #1 communal bank for eight years. She is very pleased that thanks to the loans she has received from the Fundación Espoir, she has been able to move her family forward. She is 78 years old, a widow and she has four children who are now adults. Two of them still live with her and one of her children is sick.

In addition to being a great mother and housewife, she also sells food. She has a stall in the Portoviejo market preparing delicious meals. Her customers always order these regional dishes: el caldo de pata, la guatita, el caldo y seco de gallina ( dishes made with various parts of cow like the feet and stomach and chicken), along with other dishes. She prepares these meals with lots of love. Aura works everyday from 8am to 11pm. Her daughter helps her with the business. She says that her business has been open for many years now and that her customers prefer her food because of her food’s flavor.

This loan will be used to buy rice, chickens, soft drinks and other products and ingredients needed for her delicious dishes. Her dream is that her son will be healed and he will have good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, chickens, soft drinks and other ingredients to prepare dishes

loans.name: Salome Moncerrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Libertad #1.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Salome, ella tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 22 y 18 años, los dos estudian en Universidad. Su esposo es visitador médico.

Ella se dedica a vender productos farmacéuticos en la ciudad de Portoviejo, como Alcohol,  merthiolate,  gasas  entre otros insumos, trabaja junto al esposo, él se encarga de hacer la entrega a farmacias, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y trabaja sobre pedidos, tiene un vehículo que es en el que realizan las  entregas de los productos, trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las 8am hasta las 18h00 y los sábados hasta las 13h00. Ya llevan en este negocio cerca de  10 años, los insumos los traen desde  un laboratorio y una distribuidora en Guayaquil.
 
Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar gasas, insumos pero en especial medicinas antigripales que por la época invernal se vende mucho. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya 5 años y le gusta por la rapidez como consigue los créditos. Su  sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of 'Libertad #1' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the 'city of the royal tamarind trees'.

Here we meet 48 year-old Salome.  She is married and has two children aged 22 and 18 from her relationship.  Both of her children are at university.  Her husband is a medical sales representative.

Salome sells pharmaceutical products in the city of Portoviejo.  She sells products such as alcohol, Merthiolate and gauze.  She works together with her husband.  He makes deliveries to pharmacies.  Their business is in their home and they work on orders.  They have a vehicle which they use to deliver their products.  They work from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm, and Saturdays until 1.00pm.  They have been in this business for nearly 10 years.  They get their supplies from a laboratory and also from a wholesaler's in Guayaquil.

Salome will use this loan to buy gauze and supplies but especially anti-flu medicines which sell a lot over the winter.  She has been a member of her community bank for 5 years and she likes the speed with which she can obtain loans.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy gauze, anti-flu medicines and supplies

loans.name: María Solanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Libertad #1.
 
La señora María esta en el Banco Comunal  Libertad #1 desde hace ya 4 años y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la Fundación Espoir, ella tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos todos mayores e independientes. Su esposo es ebanista.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa por catalogo y también en  ventas personales, trabaja de lunes a viernes en sus entregas y los cobros  realiza los días sábados,  compra su mercadería en Guayaquil y en ocasiones le toca viajar a Huaquillas. También tiene una pequeña librería en su casa, el negocio de la ropa lo tiene hace 12 años y la librería 7 años, nos cuenta que gracias a dios todo le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar camisetas, pantalones y en especial ropa de niños. Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio y tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known for many years as the “City of the Royal Tamarind Trees,” there is a meeting every 15 days of the members of the Libertad #1 communal bank.

Maria has been a member of the group for four years, and she likes it for the additional services provided by Fundación Espoir. Maria is 54 years old, is married, and has four children, all of them grown and independent. Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

Aside from being a homemaker, Maria has a business selling clothing from a catalog, and also selling personal items. She works Monday through Friday making deliveries and then collects on Saturday. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and occasionally also travels to Huaquillas. 

Maria also has a small bookstore in her home. She has operated the clothing business for 12 years and the bookstore for 7. She says that, thanks to God, everything has gone very well.

This loan will be used to purchase t-shirts, pants, and especially children’s clothing. Maria’s dream is to enlarge her business and have a big bazaar.

loans.use: Buy t-shirts, pants, and children's clothing

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:

Adelaida has been engaged in her business for almost one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Adelaida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut W. is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut is the group leader of a 14-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Babi Rahayu (PK-10378).


Ni Ketut is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, Ni Ketut owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.The most enjoyable part of this effort is  feeding the pigs. They look voracious and greatly enjoy their food so that their growth is very good and very fast. 


In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

Ni Ketut W. is very grateful for this loan. She did not have enough capital to buy piglets and good quality feed, and now all these things are fulfilled. She hopes, with this loan, her business will grow and her family's lifestyle will improve.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Ketut W. (0) merupakan 46 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 14 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Babi Rahayu (PK-10378).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 0,200 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.500.000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut S. is a 30-year-old married woman who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh in Cambodia. Khut S. earns an income for living by sewing cloth for her neighbors in her community. She also shares her sewing knowledge with her trainees for additional fee, earning an income of approximately $3 per day. Khut S. has a life partner in her husband, who works in the construction field as worker. This couple is married many years ago but they don’t have one child. Presently, Khut S. said that her house is not comfortable because her house is getting old and it is broken a few part. She would like to request a loan from Kiva to repair the part of her broken house. Khut S. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To repair the part of her broken house.

To make a living, Restituto plants and harvests rice for sale. Restituto has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Restituto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Restituto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 24,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Restituto is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Restituto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina S. is a widow who lives in Purok 9, Brgy. Tinago, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental, in the Philippines. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling coffee, juice and personal products, and a piggery business. Regina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Regina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 (Philippine pesos) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for the personal product business and buy medicines and vaccines for the pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Regina S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the "NWTF Kiva lending team" on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more personal products to sell to her customers

In 2006, George joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by George from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
50-year-old Marilou C. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is married and has 6 children. Her eldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is 15. Three of her children still go to school and Marilou works hard to sustain their education.  

Marilou is involved in rice farming. She has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than a few years now. She always aims to increase her harvest so that she would also earn more.

Marilou joined CEVI to gain access to financial services. She finds it very useful and hopes the MFI will expand and serve more farmers like her. She applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will be very helpful to Marilou's farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

texts.en: Rodolfo O. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 53 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Rodolfo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 28 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Rodolfo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia Blasé raises ducks and makes balut (a boiled, fertilized egg) to earn a living. She is 46 years old, married and has 3 children ages 13, 12 and 8. Her children go to school. Nemia makes sure she can sustain their education because she wants them to finish college and be professionals.

Nemia raises ducks to produce and use the eggs to make balut. Sometimes the eggs produced are not enough so she has to buy from other sellers to make more balut. Nemia hopes to acquire more ducks so she will have enough eggs to sell and make balut from. Nemia also raises some chickens.

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase more ducks, feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Nerry

texts.en:
Nerry O., 58 years old, is from the town of Santo Niño. She is married and has 3 children ages 18, 17 and 15. She works hard to sustain her children's education. Two of her kids are in college and she hopes for them to graduate and find appropriate jobs. 

Nerry is a farmer. She and her husband own land that they cultivate. They plant rice crops and sell their harvest to the market. Nerry wants to increase their harvest so she does her best to keep the crops healthy. Her farm still needs fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP from CEVI, a KIVA partner. This loan will help her farm immensely.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en: Cuc C. T. (109) is a 50-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Cuc is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh (030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh). Cuc is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Cuc operates a family member's business cultivating fruit trees and harvesting fruit for saL.. Cuc has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2005, Cuc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cuc has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 7th loan taken out by her from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cuc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Binh B. T. (131) is a 34 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Huong L. T. (104) is a 47 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. Cai T. T. (71) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Ha L. T. (60) is a 40 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. Dinh N. T. (56) is a 38 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Cuc C. T. (109) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa. Cuc là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh (030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng cây ăn trái & thu hoạch trái để bán. Cuc thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 11 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Cuc kiếm được khoảng 5,000,000 VND. Vào 2005, Cuc đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Cuc đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua hạt giống bổ sung, cây giống & cây con để trồng. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Binh B. T. (131) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Huong L. T. (104) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Cai T. T. (71) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Ha L. T. (60) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. Dinh N. T. (56) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn D. R. is a rice farmer from the town of Santo Niño. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children ages 12, 10 and 2. She wants her children to be able to finish their studies.

Roselyn owns and tills her own land. She plants and harvests rice crops for sale. She wants her service to their community to be better so she aims for quality rice. Roselyn's rice farm needs additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She likes its services, especially that it comes with a microinsurance program. She is hopeful that her loan will be very useful for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for Joan, 39. She supports her 17-year-old child. Her farm is just enough to provide their basic needs. Joan is working hard to improve her family's living conditions. She hopes to have a successful business that would give her family a stable income.

Joan joined Community Economic Ventures Inc. to obtain a loan to finance her business. She’s requesting 4,000 Php to buy farm necessities and sustain her family.

loans.use: To buy farm necessities

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma D., 45, is a farmer from Agusan del sur.  She has a farm and sells fruit to provide for her family.  She’s a mother of seven children, and the eldest is 24 years old.  Alma wants her children to receive a proper education and be able to finish college. She hopes for her children to have appropriate jobs and have bright futures.

Alma needs additional capital to finance her farm. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and has requested a loan of 4,000 Php.  She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Hercules

texts.en:
Hercules, 19, is living in Agusan del sur and has a rice farm.  Being single, he devotes his time to working on his farm. He is also saving for his college education. His dream is to graduate from college and get a good job so he can help his family. 

Hercules heard that Community Economic Ventures, Inc. offers financial support to entrepreneurs like him and joined. His business is continually growing and now he is requesting a loan of 4,000 Php.  The loan will help sustain his business while keeping interest charges low.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn P., 41, is a farmer from Agusan del Sur.  She manages a farm.  She also has a sari-sari store business.  She sells soy sauce, vinegar and other frequently used products. Genalyn supports her family of four children, the eldest of whom is 20 years old.  She works hard in order to earn more.

Her capital is limited, which is why she joined in Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to access a loan.  She’s requesting 4,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to support her business, buying farm and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: farm requirements and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo V. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 45 years old. Eduardo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eduardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP that will also be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Eduardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina O. lives in Trinidad Bohol. She is a wife and a passionate mother to her five children. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store since 2007. She sells a variety of goods so that she can help her husband earn a living for the family. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 3,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the money to expand her business and add additional goods to resell. In that way, she believes that she will be able to increase her profit and support the needs of her family.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira A. is from the town of Trinidad Bohol. She has been a food vendor since 2000. She has five children. Everyday, she sells food in the street to be able to save enough money for the educational needs of her children.

By getting a loan from CEVI, she said it would help her expand her business. She would like to apply for a loan because this would make her business competitive and more profitable.

The income she will be able to generate will help her family buy adequate supplies of food and other basic needs.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila M., 49 years old, owns a small sari-sari (variety) store in Talibon Bohol. She works very hard to be able to meet the needs of her family. She has three sons. She dreamed that she would be able to send her children to school, which is why she sells a variety of goods while also growing rice.

She is applying for a loan of 6,000 PHP. With this loan, she plans to buy more merchandise to resell. In that way, she would also be able to offer her customers with a larger variety of products. She believes that by working hard she can raise the economic living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou P., 40 years old, has been selling a variety of food items in the streets since 2000. She lives in Talibon, Bohol.  She has a sari-sari store and five children. She would like to augment the income of her family. Funding from CEVI will allow her to expand her inventory.

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to buy firewood, shampoo and other merchandise to resell in her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: 0305013-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh Group

Tam T. T. (75) is a 35-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa.  Tam is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Tam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Tam from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0305013-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh (0305013-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ thực phẩm cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tam thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tam kiếm được khoảng 3,500,000 VND.  Vào 2004, Tam đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tam đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose O. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 58 years old. Jose is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Jose owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jose has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 34,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Jose is requesting a new loan of 39,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Jose from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine I. of Talibon, Bohol has a sari-sari and bakery store that she runs with her husband. Funding from CEVI would allow them to expand their inventory.

They would also use the money to buy ingredients like milk, flour and sugar for their bakery. This would make them more competitive and increase their income.

They have three children. The additional income would help provide for the family's daily needs and enable them to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell and ingredients for the bakery

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa B. is from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in mat weaving. She wants to buy more materials for making mats. In that way, she will be able to expand her business and earn a better income for her family.

She would also use the money to start another livelihood. She is interested in other income opportunities so that she can save more money for the educational expenses of her children.

The income of her business goes directly towards her family for buying food, clothes and other basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for making mats

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G. is from the village of Aguinaldo, Cordon. She is 58 years old. Teresita is widowed and has eight adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 0305014-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en:
Lien N. T. (12) is a 50- year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa.  Lien is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 0305014-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh (0305014-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh).


Lien is married and has four adult children.  To make a living, Lien operates a family member's business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Lien has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Thinh (105) is a 42-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Chat (7) is a 38-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  L. T. Xang (41) is a 56-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her general store business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Phang D. T. is a 56 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa.  Phang is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
