Phang is married and has 3 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Phang owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for saL..  Phang has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,400,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, Phang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Phang has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Phang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: José

texts.es: José C. T., reside en Tacachico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, él es una persona muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza día con día para salir adelante y así también sostener a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad. José se dedica a la venta ambulante de helados tales como: sorbetes, paletas, bolis y otros más, los cuales comercializa por diferentes colonias, él trabaja de lunes a domingo esforzándose al máximo por obtener mayores ganancias. José solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir comprando mayor cantidad de helados y de esta forma poder ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes y así mismo aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
José C. T. lives in Tacachico which is located in La Libertad department.  He is a very hard-working person who works hard every day to get ahead in life and support his family: his wife and three dependent children.

José works as a street trader selling frozen treats such as sorbets, fruit-based ice lollies, popsicles, etc.  He sells his products in different districts.  He works from Monday to Sunday, working as hard as possible to make as much profit as possible.

José is requesting a loan so that he can invest in buying more frozen treats and, in this way, offer more products to his customers and thereby increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy frozen treats to sell

loans.name: Urgamal

texts.en:
Urgamal is 42 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. In 1999 she divorced her first husband and moved to the capital with her four children from the countryside. At that time it was hard for her to raise her four children alone, and she had nothing except her four children. Urgamal, however, is a very hardworking woman with a strong will.

Urgamal has been a hairdresser since moving to the capital city. She rented a corner with her eldest daughter, Sarantungalag, 21, who is also a hairdresser and works with her. Urgamal has gained valuable experience in previous years and has a loyal customer base. Her second husband, Batmunkh, works as a firefighter at the state’s emergency department.

Urgamal is planning to open her own salon and give her children a good education and morals. Part of her loan will be used to pay for some necessary furniture for her son who recently moved out, and the other part will be used to pay her younger daughter’s tuition fees.

loans.use: For furniture and tuition fees

loans.name: Silvia Estela

texts.es: Silvia Estela A., es una mujer muy esforzada y responsable, la cual reside junto a su hijo en San Juan Opico, lugar en el cual posee su negocio gracias al cual cuenta con ingresos necesarios para poseer una vida digna. Ella trabaja en su tienda, en la cual comercializa productos alimenticios y de uso domésticos, su negocio tiene 3 años de estar establecido, tiempo en el cual Silvia a tratado de surtirlo con todo lo necesario y más esencial para percibir buenas ganancias. Silvia solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para surtir la tienda y de esta forma brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes de forma que estos la prefieran en todo momento.
texts.en:
Silvia Estela A. is a very hard-working and responsible woman who lives together with her son in San Juan Opico where she has a business which provides her with the necessary income to lead a decent life.  She works in her store, in which she sells food and convenience store products.  She has had her business for 3 years, during which time she has tried to stock it with all the most essential and necessary products in order to make good profits.

Silvia is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can have the necessary money to stock her store and thereby provide a better service to her customers in order to gain their loyalty.

loans.use: To buy convenience store items

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira I. is from the town of Talibon Bohol. She is 40 years old and has been a food vendor since 2000. She has five children. She works so hard from morning to evening to be able to save enough money for her family.

Funding from CEVI will help her expand her business. She would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 PHP. This would make her business competitive and more profI..

The income she will be able to generate will help her family buy adequate supplies of food and other basic needs.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Elpidio

texts.en:
Elpidio S. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 62 years old. Elpidio is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elpidio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elpidio has been engaged in his business for over 32 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elpidio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elpidio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 33,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Elpidio is requesting a new loan of 38,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Elpidio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris L. lives in the town of Talibon Bohol. She is 34 years old and has been engaged in a food retailing business since 2000. She sells "puto" (rice cake) and other delicacies. She has four children. She works very hard to earn enough income for her family's basic needs.

Funding from CEVI will help her to realize her plan of expanding her business. She would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 PHP. She will use it to buy ingredients for making delicacies.

The income from her business will also help her buy adequate supplies of food and fulfill other basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making delicacies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is from the village of Aguinaldo Cordon. She is 55 years old. Josefina is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Josefina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María Alicia Teodora

texts.es: María Alicia Teodora L. D. C., resiD. en la cabecera departamental D. Santa Ana en donD. vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposo, un señor muy responsable con su hogar, así mismo por su hija y un nieto. María trabaja en su casa D. habitación, elaborando desayunos y almuerzos, y así mismo elaborando tortillas, su negocio es bastante estable ya que ella es una persona muy limpia y amable para atender a sus clientes, así como también una excelente cocinera. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar materia prima para elaborar lo alimentos como: granos básicos, verduras y frutas, así mismo comprar leña y maíz por mayor. D. esta forma ella espera mejorar en gran manera su negocio y así mismo percibir mayores ganancias las cuales son lo principal para ella ya que le permitirán contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
María Alicia Teodora L. D. C. lives in the departmental capital of Santa Ana together with her family; her husband, who is very responsible when it comes to his household, her daughter and a grandson.  María works in her home making breakfasts and lunches and also making tortillas.  Her business is quite stable since she is a very clean and kind person when serving her customers.  She is also an excellent cook.

María is requesting a loan so that she can buy ingredients for preparing her food such as basic grains and fruit and vegetables.  She will also buy firewood and corn wholesale.  In this way she hopes to improve her business a lot and also make more profits which are the most important thing as they allow her to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, firewood and vegetables to make her food

loans.name: Jerose

texts.en:
Jerose M. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Jerose is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jerose owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice per kilogram in the local community. Jerose has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jerose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerose is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional rice to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jerose from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria M., from Talibon Bohol, has a food store that she has been running for 10 years already. Aside from the usual food items that she sells, like "puto" and "bibingka" (types of rice cakes), she believes that funding from CEVI would allow her to sell more products and expand her business. This would make her business more competitive and profitable.

Apolinaria has four children. The additional income would help her provide for the family's daily needs and enable her to send her children to school.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Aleyda Yanira

texts.es: Aleyda Yanira C. C. de 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y junto a los cuales reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Aleyda realiza diferentes actividades para poder sostener su hogar, debido a que ella no cuenta con ningún tipo de ayuda para mantener a sus hijos y su casa. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, así mismo comercializa queso, crema y cilindros de gas propano, todo lo realiza en su hogar lo cual es una ventaja ya que esta junto a sus hijos. Aleyda solicita un préstamo con la esperanza de poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos para aumentar sus ventas, ya que sólo de esta manera ella podrá contar con una mejor estabilidad económica y así mismo brindarles estudio, vestimenta y todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aleyda Yanira C. C. is a 37 year old single mother. She has three young children attending school and they live together in the Ahuachapan Department.

Aleyda does different activities since she does not have any other assistance to support her children and her home. She makes and sells tortillas. She also sells cheese, cream and propane tanks. She is able to do these activities out of her house which is advantageous because this allows her to be near her children. 

Aleyda is requesting this loan to buy more products to increase her sales which will provide better economic stability and enable her to continue providing schooling, clothing and the various necessities for her children.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and propane gas

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is from the village of Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Alicia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling beauty products like cosmetics, from several suppliers, like AVON, NATASHA and FULLERLIFE, in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

location.town: Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia T., age 41, operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She buys and sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, snacks, and instant noodles to members of the local community. Anesia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. She and her husband have five school-aged children and the family lives in the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City.

In 2009, Anesia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Anesia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Anesia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory to offer for sale and utilized as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Anesia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to offer for sale and to use as working capital

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cirilina

texts.en:
Cirilina L., who is 50 years old, is a fish vendor from San Francisco, Agusan del Sur. She has four children. She wants to expand her business so that she can send all her children to school. Cirilina also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. She helps plant and harvest their rice crops for sale.

She thinks that funding from CEVI will help her grow her business more. She will use the money from CEVI to buy more fish to resell and additional fertilizers for the farm. In that way, she will be able to earn more and provide the basic needs in their home. 

The income that she will generate from selling fish will also be utilized in paying the school fees and buying home supplies.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and fertilizers for rice crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts and accessories for bicycles

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites P. is from the village of Aguinaldo Cordon. She is 36 years old. Marites is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she  plants and harvests fruits and vegetables to sell. She also manages a hog raising business. Marites has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn O. is a farmer. She does this for her livelihood. She has spent her entire life taking care of rice plants. 

She wants to expand her business. To do that she needs to increase her harvest. Funding from CEVI will help her buy fertilizers and quality rice seeds. In this way, she will be able to ensure a quality harvest as well. 

Through planting rice, she is able to send her children to school and provide their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria R. de 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y una pequeña nieta de 9 años de edad, junto a quienes reside en el departamento de Sonsonate. Ana es una persona que se dedica a diferentes actividades para poder contar con una fuente de ingresos que le permita vivir de forma estable. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante, así mismo compra y vende oro, dicha actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 6 años. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora quien solicita un préstamo a Integral con el enorme deseo de contar con el monto de dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de frutas y verduras, ya que es dicho negocio el cual le permite contar con más ganancias debido a que es una venta más estable la cual realiza todos los días de la semana.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria R. is 50 years old.  She lives together with her husband, two children and 9 year-old granddaughter, in Sonsonate department.  Ana is a person who works in a number of activities in order to have a source of income which allows her to live a stable life.  She sells fruit and vegetables as a street trader.  She also buys and sells gold, an activity which she has been engaged in for 6 years.

Ana is a very hard-working person who is requesting a loan from Integral as she really wants to have the necessary money to invest in buying a greater quantity and variety of fruit and vegetables since this is the business which makes her most profits owing to the fact that it makes more stable sales.  She carries out this business every day of the week.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
Rubylyn S. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 29 years old. Rubylyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately $143 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rubylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Rubylyn is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 3rd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jonie

texts.en:
Jonie O. is from the town of San Francisco, Agusan del Sur. He provides transportation in his community by running a tricycle business. He also owns a small parcel of land where he plants rice and root crops. 

He would like to expand his business. He is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy farm supplies for his rice farm. He will also spend some of the loan money for the maintenance of his tricycle. Jonie earns about $6.25 a day from his tricycle business.

The products on his farm also help him provide his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and use for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco G. S. de 57 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, en donde posee su propio negocio y así mismo reside junto a su esposa quien trabaja vendiendo tortillas, así también vive junto a tres nietos de: 12, 8 y 5 años de edad. Él es un señor muy emprendedor, quien posee su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y es el que le permite contar con todo lo necesario para vivir de una forma estable junto a su familia. José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: bebidas, pan, golosinas, desinfectantes, detergentes, pan, cereales y todos los productos que más son solicitados por sus clientes. El mayor deseo de José es el de poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que son estas las que le permiten, junto al trabajo que realiza su esposa, sostener  su hogar.
texts.en:
José Francisco S. is 21 years old.  He lives in Sonsonate department where he has his own business.  He lives with his wife, who works making tortillas, and three grandchildren aged 12, 8 and 5.  He is a very enterprising man who has his own business, a sotre in which he sells perishables and convenience store items.  His business is located in his home and it allows him to have everything he needs to live a stable life together with his family.

José is requesting a loan to buy more products such as drinks, bread, candies, disinfectants, detergents, cereals and all the other products which are most requested by his customers.  José's greatest wish is to be able to improve his sales since they are what allows him, together with the work his wife does, to support him household.

loans.use: To buy perishables to invest in his store

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina D., 47 years old, is a farmer from San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice. Most of the products from her farm are reserved for family consumption and the rest is sold to rice traders in their location. Her income is enough to support her family and buy the basic needs in their home. 

She said she liked joining the CEVI micro-credit program because of the micro-insurance benefits. She believes that by getting a loan from CEVI, she will be able to expand her business and support her family better. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Verónica Leidi

texts.es: Verónica Leidi M. O. de  37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, con quien reside en Colón, en el departamento de La Libertad. La señora Verónica posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica de surtir su negocio, esto debido a que Verónica no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su esposo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son de primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda. Verónica espera mejorar las ganancias y de esta forma contar con una vida más estable.
texts.en: Verónica Leidi M. O. is 37 years old.  She lives with her husband in Colón, in La Libertad department.  Verónica has a store in which she sells perishables and convenience store goods.  Her store is located in her home.  She is requesting a loan so that she can stock her business as she currently doesn't have enough money to do so.  It is very important both for herself and her husband since it is her business which covers their family expenses.  Verónica would like to stock her store with products such as detergents, canned food, bread, candies, drinks and other products which are basic essentials in the home and most requested in a store.  Verónica hopes to improve her profits and thereby be able to lead a more stable life.

loans.use: To buy convenience store items to stock her store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta M. is 46 years old and runs a small clothing business and a farm. She lives in San Francisco, Agusan del Sur. She wants to improve her house and to expand her business. By planting rice and selling used clothes, she adds to her income, which is helpful in meeting all her family's needs. 

She has four children and she is supporting their education. She wants all of her children to succeed in their studies so that when they are older, they can find better employment and support the needs of their future families.

She chose CEVI because it has an insurance coverage package for all of its clients. She applied for a loan of 4,000 PHP which she will use to buy farm supplies and more used clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and clothes to sell

loans.name: Lysel

texts.en:
Lysel A. is 35 years old and runs a small rice farm. She doesn’t mind working all day under the heat of the sun in order to ensure that her family has an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs. She has three daughters. She dreams that all of her children will be able to finish college. When she is able to do that, she will be the happiest mother on Earth.

She would like to apply for a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds. The loan will help her increase her harvest and income.

She chose CEVI because she likes the program and because she has micro-insurance coverage in CEVI.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds

loans.name: Emelecio

texts.es: Emelecio M. es una persona muy esforzada quien ha trabajado muy duro por sacar adelante a su familia. Él vive junto a su esposa  y no posee hijos. Luis posee un molino el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación la cual esta ubicada en Ciudad Arce, en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde las personas llegan a moler: maíz, frijoles, verduras y diferentes tipos de alimentos ya sea para elaborar algún tipo de masa o para hacer salsas. Emelecio solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar un molino más y de esta forma atender a más personas, ya que muchas veces no da abasto con el que ya posee. Él desea mucho mejorar su negocio, debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee para vivir de una forma digna.
texts.en:
Emelecio M. is a very determined person who has worked very hard to get his family ahead in life.  He lives with his wife and doesn't have any children.  Luis owns a mill which is located in his home, in Ciudad Arce, in La Libertad department.  People come to him to grind corn, beans, pulses and other different types of food, either to make some kind of dough or to make sauces.

Emelecio is requesting a loan so that he can buy another mill and thereby serve more people since often he can't serve enough customers with the one he already owns.  He would very much like to improve his business as it is the sole source of income he has for living a decent life.

loans.use: To buy a mill

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.en:
Leocadio V. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 46 years old. Leocadio is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 23 years and earns approximately $117 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leocadio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Leocadio is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 3rd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evelyn L. is from the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is a farmer. Growing rice is her cup of tea. In addition to rice farming, she also sells fish in their village. She is doing the best she can to earn enough money for the needs of her family.

She would like to apply for a loan at CEVI. She will use the loan in buying farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. The loan would help her expand her business and increase her harvest and income. 

She said she likes the CEVI program because she is covered with a micro-insurance program in CEVI.

loans.use: farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty S., age 33, makes a living by selling fish in Phnom Penh City. She sells fish that she buys from other fisherman in the local market. She currently earns an average of US $5 a day, and she has operated her business since the beginning of the year. Her husband is 38 years old and is a trailer taxi driver.  He earns an income to support her family's daily expenses.

Ty S. is the mother of two teenage children who are in school. Recently, her husband’s motorbike broke down while providing his service. Because of that, Ty S. has decided to seek a loan of $500 from Kiva, which she will use for her husband to replace the broken motorcycle.

Ty S. was not available at that day, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To replace broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros A. owns a small rice field. She tills the land and shares her harvest with her children. Most of the products from her farm are saved for family consumption and the rest is sold to rice traders. In addition to a rice farm, she also ventures into selling processed meat. 

She is looking for other income opportunities that could help her earn more. She would like to apply for a loan to expand her rice farm. The loan will be utilized in buying fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: buying fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Tussekimu Development Association-Mpigi Group

texts.en:
N. Majoline is a part of the Tussekimu Development Association, Mpigi. She has been selling soft drinks for the last five years in Bogga, Mpigi. She says she began this business on her own without anybody's backing. She opened it using money she had saved from her farming.

This happily married mother of three says she earns 100,000 UGX a month. N. says with this loan she is going to buy more crates of drinks such as soda, juices and water to sell.

loans.use: To buy crates of sodas, juices and water to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita A. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 58 years old. Estelita is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Estelita owns and operates a business making and selling chocolate balls to the local community. Estelita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2005, Estelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estelita is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Estelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale
